description:
This is a good place to get some work done - there is free wifi, plenty of seating and some outlets available. The indoors part of the cafe is a bit dark, but the back patio is spacious and bright. 

Coffee selection is quite extensive - they offer flat whites, which isn't on the menu at all cafes, and the coffee art was beautiful.
author: Yolanda C.

description:
Excellent coffee beverages and service!  Luis was extremely friendly, attentive and eager to provide high quality customer service.  It is nice to see someone who seems happy to be at work!  Lina made our lattes and we watched as she carefully and diligently craft not only delicious but artistic beverages!  She appeared to put great care into ensuring that we were happy with our order and we appreciated the service with a smile.  The facilities were very clean and the atmosphere was welcoming and relaxing. 

My party of six took a table in the sunny, clean patio and were able to order food from Pork Store Cafe next door; the food was wonderful too.  Everything we ordered tasted very fresh and flavorful, and I saw many menu items that I would like to come back and try at another time!  Prices are very reasonable for the quality and amount of food you get (and I have a large appetite).  The owner came to greet us and check on us several times, which was nice.  All in all, this was a great first time experience here and everyone in my party is planning on another visit soon! Thank you for a lovely Saturday morning brunch with great food, beverages, customer service and atmosphere!
author: Corinna L.

description:
I love the chill vibes that this coffee shop emits. There is relaxing music played in the background (albeit a bit loud and you can clearly hear it even with earphones on unless you have the noise cancelling headphones). The lighting is slightly dim and conveys an intimate setting.  There are outlets on the wall and many people come here to work on their laptops. 

The interior design of this place is also phenomenal. Very detailed and meticulous, ornate designs placed on the walls. Love it!

I ordered the thai iced tea, which was alright. It wasn't very sweet or milky, two things I would have preferred. My boyfriend ordered the cold brew and said it wasn't acidic at all. He thought the drink was particularly good here.

 (Sidenote: the bathroom here is really modern, cool, and clean)
author: Karen Y.

description: Reminds me of a Seattle coffee house. Super quaint inside and unassuming, but delicious coffee with only one serving size (which I love). Walked in here on a whim after grooming dogs and the latte was legit. Love it!
author: Joanna R.

description:
This place was A-OK, we were looking for coffee and of course, why not go to an amazing stand alone vs a Sbux if you can? The ordering was easy enough, we walked in and got a cold brew. They immediately brewed up and we got it quickly. I wish I had gotten their amazing looking cookies, specifically the half pb and half chocolate but next time. I took one star off because while the coffee was good it was slightly too acidic for my taste. We sat on their patio which was nice and had a beautiful wall mural but was ridden with a ton of flies. 

Overall, A-OK.
author: Amy K.

description: Loved this place - when lots of coffeeshops in SF didn't seem to have wifi, Stanza Coffee saved the day. Aside from having the perfect brew, the wifi was fast and the bathrooms were clean. Everyone was friendly and it was a super comfy place to settle down and work for a little while. It would be a great place to catch up with a friend or do a little bit of work - the environment is perfect and relaxed. Highly recommended!
author: Alex L.

description:
Found this coffee shop while waiting for a shop to open nearby by.  I'm glad I stopped here almost everything at this coffee shop is great.  
Pros: 
* Ultra clean and probably the most high tech bathroom I've been in.  You need to ask and then they print off a qr code for you. 
* great ambience.  Nice setup with seating outside and inside with very chill music playing overhead. 
* WiFi shows up on my WiFi list I didn't need it so didn't bother.  Update: they do have WiFi. 
* Staff very friendly and welcoming

Cons: 
* The only con I have is my coffee tastes like it's been sitting for a little bit too long it has that slight burnt taste. I'm not docking any stars b/c they are quite friendly and I bet they would've been happy to swap out my coffee. 

Overall, perfect place in my books.  I'll definitely be back. I'll make it a point to get over here early to hit up this coffee shop. The only thing missing is some local beans roasting in the back like Flywheel :).
author: Mike S.

description:
Cool vibe! Stanza has secretly hidden in the middle of Mission area and serves great coffee earlier in the morning. One shall notice the huge flor paintings on the wall leading inside the grand hall way. 

Free wifi too, so very convenient for people looking for a place to have a short rest. Unfortunately, they only carry 2% fat milk.
author: Elaine H.

description: This cute coffee shop in the mission has a lot of character and pretty good coffee. The best part is that they actually have an outdoor back patio you can sip you coffee at on a nice day.
author: Tina L.

description:
Wandered in here after an errand on Mission Street.

Came for the fancy looking coffee set up--big upgrade over Muddy Water. Did not disappoint--my cappuccino was tasty af.

The highlight, besides having a sweet patio (covered), noticeably good WiFi, and a healthy amount of outlets spread around the indoor space, was there high tech bathroom!

Yes you need a code to access it, but you can also queue up in line via their App, Good2Go. Once inside, the entire bathroom is hands free, including a sensor to open the door on your way out. Very clean.
author: Paolo V.

description: Expensive but quality ingredients, you can definitely taste the tea in their iced team, nothing artificial here! The interior of the cafe is pretty dark, so is the front patio, so if you're wanting to work/study somewhere comfortably for a long period of time, can't say this is ideal. They do have long tables though in case you needed to spread out and it never got super busy, so you didn't feel guilty for staying a little while. The back patio was absolutely gorgeous though and felt like it was a completely different space - it gets the best sunlight, is warm and cozy, and is beautifully designed. That was probably the only space that stayed consistently busy and full. Super nice service though.
author: Ellen C.

description:
I think Stanza is at least a bit more special than all the other cafes in SF because it has a good amount of seating in and outside, fast wifi, and their lattes are as strong as cappuccinos, all of which I appreciate

Easily see myself coming back either to meet friends or do some work
author: Jeanie N.

description: What a nice find in the city! Perfect spot to get some work done outside of the house. They have a good amount of seating with many people sharing tables. Also, super fast wifi that connected in a cinch. I tried some of the Thai Tea and the Waffle, which were both very yummy.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
A great coffee shop to catch up on work or friends. Their prices were a bit high. On a Saturday afternoon we were looking forward on sitting out on the patio after ordering our drinks, but it was completely packed. Found a table inside to settle into. 

Staff was incredibly friendly. 

Bathroom was very confusing. They had a super advance ticketing system you needed to get from the register, to scan to get into. It was a bit too much.
author: Nancy Q.

description:
Love this spot! The staff is so friendly and great. There is also a beautiful outside patio in the back. Great for relaxing on weekends. 

And of course the coffee is delicious. Try one of the vegan cookies :)
author: Teresa C.

description: Best coffee in the Bay. Barista was so badass and kind and their cold brew is the best I've ever had. Free wifi and plenty of outlets for working. Amazing little spot in the Mission!
author: Kristen H.

description:
A cool coffee bar with nice, calming music. Quiet and a good place to get some work done. 

Small little patio at the front that's great for a nice day. Oddly enough, not too much seating but this place is kind of hidden so not many people seem to come through here. Quite the hidden gem!

Oh! And my iced latte was served in a mason jar, so that's a plus
author: Jimmy L.

description:
This place is adorable, everything from the décor to the baristas. I like that the storefront is deep into the sidewalk to incorporate front patio seating. There's plenty of seating inside and even on the back patio. Great place to read a book, get work done, or catch up with a friend, the latter of which I did. Unfortunately I had to take a client call  halfway through, but the back patio was great for that. There's even WiFi!

I had some house coffee, but the muffins caught my eye while I ordered. I couldn't resist. Mmm blueberry muffin... So tasty. #NoRegrets. The barista was super sweet too. Just the combination of a relaxing yet productive atmosphere makes this now one of my favorite coffeeshops in San Francisco. I can't wait to come back!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Excellent cappuccino. High tech bathroom. Great staff. So many laptops. Must be impressive Wi-Fi.
author: branden b.

description: The person at the counter is a bathroom Nazi! I obtained a ticket to go in and since my partner is already outside that I held the bathroom open for him. I was scolded by the bathroom Nazi and told me that I need to get my partner get a ticket to go in to keep the bathroom clean. Meanwhile the bathroom toilet seat is filthy. So much said about having a high tech bathroom. I will never comeback here. Coffee is mediocre at best!
author: Dante R.

description: Best bathroom EVERRRRRR! After my coffee use the bathroom after you great coffee! People are great too!!
author: RICHARD J.

description: A really cute coffee shop in the Mission. It's slightly tucked away from the bustle of the street. Good wifi, lovely lattes, and a nice patio outside for the beautiful sunny days. I will definitely be back!
author: Helen F.

description:
This is a really nice coffee shop with good coffee and delicious pastries. The guy working there told us that they don't sell very large coffees because otherwise people just go there to work and stay forever with their large drink. So I take that it's not very work friendly, and I'm totally fine with that because I rather come here to hang with friends. That said, every time I go there are at least a couple of people coding on their laptops, so it's not like you can't do it. 

They also have a cute back patio.
author: Marta F.

description:
It was a sunny Saturday Morning! 
This place was cute! they brew their coffee in these manual brewers where you can see them, it has that hint of an antique layout to it. like their seats and tables and some decor. the floor was wooden and has a bar-like layout for the rest of the seats. Kevin and I just wanted something to drink while we wait for Cha Cha Cha down the street and this place was a great kickin spot! 

I got earl grey tea my fave and Kev tried their iced Kyoto coffee and we also got pastries. 
Their restroom is like hidden at the very back where they need to buzz you in bc the restrooms are for customers only.
author: Jozza M.

description:
$4 for a small decaff coffee ?
Sorry buddy ! You shouldn't charge people $4 bucks for this small decaff coffee. How much you profit from a cup of coffee ? 300% ?
author: Arthur W.

description:
Great little hipster coffee shop in the Mission. It's quiet, the music isn't too loud and overall, it's a nice space to get some work done. I recently came here with my laptop and sat on the bar stools at the back. Unfortuantely, it does get quite crowded, so if you're coming to get work done be mindful you might not be able to easily snag a seat. 

They have some nice teas and the coffee is probably good. I didn't try it.

Takeaway message: chill coffee shop; good place to get work done. wifi is fast!
author: Priti K.

description: Pretty comfortable spot. Chocolate-chip oatmeal cookies are all right.
author: John L.

description:
I don't know what happened to this place, and it disappoints me greatly.

I used to love coming here for the back porch with a croissant and a latte and stay for a couple of hours reading on a Sunday. The staff was nice enough, and on weekday mornings, I stuck with the batch brew because everything took impossibly too long. But it was fine because I liked the management. 

I stepped in here a couple of weeks ago and it felt very off. The cups have gotten smaller, the usual hip baristas are no where to be found, and they play elevator music. The pastries are subpar than the ones from before.

Stanza must have changed ownership - its the only explanation and boy, it is palpable. Its missing the heart that it once had, so I guess I'll be finding a new local coffehouse to patronize.
author: Jessi R.

description: Yeah - guy behind the counter is straight up a liar. Three of us walked in and two of us went literally straight to the counter to order while my friend walked towards the bathroom. He looked at our friend walking to the restroom and I told him oh she just needs to use the restroom and was about to place my order when he looked at us angrily and said it was broken and then proceeded to not pay attention to us even though we were standing right in front of the counter. We were like um clearly ur lying cause your sign outside says the bathroom is great!? We awkwardly walked out as he definitely did not want to serve us but called him out first for lying to us because he thought we weren't gonna order. Yeah dude - someone reviewed u yesterday saying ur bathroom worked. And some coffee would have been nice too.
author: erin M.

description: There baklava was so good! Very cute cafe close to mission district and Dolores Park!
author: Stephanie O.

description: Nice big space with high ceilings and beautiful cultural decorations. Good wifi and super friendly staff. Almond milk doesn't foam well so I opted for the pour over, which I enjoyed. Also loved the chill-hop music they were playing~*~. Great option if you're looking for a place to work or have a quiet conversation in the Mission area!
author: Michelle C.

description:
The menu and the coffee is simple here, definitely a lovely classic coffee shop compared to some of the hipster aesthetic spots in SF. Coffee is good but nothing super special, and for a place with free Wi-Fi they don't have many outlets and it's quite dim so a tad bit harder to get work done if light fuels your productivity.

I was disappointed that the back patio wasn't open :( But the murals on the front patio walls are nice!
author: Hana S.

description: Guys, I'm literally sitting here at Stanza while I type this. I've been coming here to do work for the last 3 years and my only complaint was the old dingy bathroom...BUT NOT ANYMORE they just redid their bathroom and it's like, the fricking future. It makes me feel like I'm in space or something. So clean and spanking new! Now this is definitely the best cafe to work at in the Mission: free wifi, plenty of outlets, good music, good snacks, chill not loud vibes, half the seats are cushioned with back support, and now HELLA CLEAN BATHROOM
author: Chin L.

description: Simple, coffee. Plain and simple. Had a wonderfully chill morning writing and reading there. Great little nook in the Mission to feel like you are squirreled away from the chaos. The mocha was delicious and the almond croissant was pretty epic. Word of advice: Don't sit in those chairs too long --your back will hate you.
author: Tina B.

description: Love this cafe! An amazing place to study with chill vibes. Also totally instagram-worthy!
author: Richa N.

description:
Great vibe and plenty of seating.

I really like their hot chocolate. It was very creamy and not too sweet, also didn't burn my mouth when I sipped it. The price was also reasonable ($3.5-5 per drink). I stayed here for 2 hours or so and didn't hear any songs on repeat.
author: Wendy F.

description: Free wifi, classic coffee menu, and plenty of oversized and delicious pastries. There are many tables to choose from, inside and outside, but you'll have to pick the right one to be close to an electrical outlet. The Thai tea was good, but I could've passed on the slight attitude when I asked where the straws were...
author: Ashley C.

description:
Pretty good coffee and friendly baristas, but for me, the best thing about this place is the plentiful outlets and seating (as long as you don't go during peak weekend hours), and the reliable WiFi. It's dark inside unlike a lot of other hipster coffee shops in the city, but comfortable.

Overall a great place to get some work done on your laptop for a few hours while sipping on some coffee
author: Sara L.

description:
It was second time to visit this place.
I wanted to get a cup of Americano, but it was not in the menu.
Pour over coffee sounds like way to fruity for me, I asked a barista if I can get Americano.
He said "I have a cup, hot water, and shot. I guess I can make it!"
I was impressed he let me have what is not on the menu.
I personally will keep coming back to this place again.
author: Davis Y.

description:
Wifi? Check. Outlets? Check. The lighting is a bit dark but this ends up saving screen brightness. Oh and the coffee is delicious and the staff are great. The music did tend more towards classic rock and some metal than I usually care for but everything else and my own headphones made this worth it.

FYI the hours are wrong! They're open until 6pm on weekdays and 7pm on weekends. (The owner says he's had trouble changing this on yelp).
author: Sophie C.

description: Very very good coffee and an excellent place to sit for a while with friends or get a little work done
author: S T.

description:
I love strong coffee but this was complete swill.

The plain coffee I bought was so bitter and burnt tasting that I had to stop myself from involuntarily spitting it out at first sip.

I generally drink my coffee black but in order to "salvage" my overpriced beverage I dumped a shit  ton of milk and sugar in it ....to no avail.

There are so many better "artisian" coffee places in the Mission

Skip this one if you actually want to drink what you buy
author: Liz K.

description: Everyone who works here is awesome. The service is never the problem, its the space itself. You can fit about 14 people (uncomfortably) at these benches tables made for toddlers. I wish that wasn't the case because their coffee and teas are exceptional.
author: Sarah T.

description: Interesting how some reviewers have had very different experiences here. In my case, I was quite impressed. Hipsterish vibe - whether the decor or the atmosphere - with none of the hipsterish pretense or annoyances that come with it. The staff here are courteous and friendly whenever I stop by (and it's quite convenient, just off 16th Street Mission BART), and there's also lots of room to spread out. And, of course, the coffee and snacks are quite good. Quite the nice coffeehouse in my book.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Cold brew was delicious. I loved the atmosphere and vibe. Baristas were nice and friendly. Cute outside patio, but I enjoyed sitting at the bar.

Free wifi and chill atmosphere.

Would come again!
author: Melanie T.

description:
I think this place has a rodent problem. Saw many droppings on the front patio. I'm not surprised though because the place doesn't look very clean. 

Don't get me wrong--the drinks and the pastries are okey dokey. One of the better places in the city if you are looking for a hipster coffee shop. Wifi is also really fast!

BUT the outside seating area throws me off. They allow smoking in the back and front patio. It seems like a place that people go to just to smoke (especially the back patio). Hard to enjoy sitting outside when all this is happening around me.
author: Anna H.

description:
Awesome spot for coffee in the Mission. Hurdle #1: Coffee is fantastic. I always judge a coffee shop based on their "regular" coffee. Strong, dark, just how it should be. So Stanza wins there. 

Hurdle #2: Seating - plenty of tables, both inside and out (patio in front AND in back), and not at all cramped or claustrophobic. Quiet enough where you can get some work done or have a conversation. 

Hurdle #3: Free wi-fi. Signal/connection was a bit iffy (couldn't send large documents, can't connect remotely to work), but for your basics surfing, it's plenty passable. It's a coffee shop, not your office, people.
author: Amelia B.

description:
Don't get me wrong, the coffee here is great. That Turning Point coffee makes some of the best pourover cups I've ever had.

So why the low rating? Well... have you ever been to a cafe where you feel like the staff is hassling for you a tip? I don't think I've ever been to a coffee shop where the staff will blatantly demand a tip... That's just not cool, and puts me in an ungenerous and unhappy mood, especially if I haven't even had my first cup of coffee in the morning yet.

Most of the staff are nice and friendly, but just one lady there does this. I go to that cafe occasionally on weekends, but there was a promo on some mobile app where free coffee was being offered for a few days, so I decided to go out of my way to Stanza for my morning coffee. As I put in the order for my coffee through the app, the lady there starts freaking out after she does the checkout process, going, "There's no place to tip. Why isn't there a place to put tip? Did I not do this right? I hope you give a tip. Why can't this thing tip?".... Ummm, ok. I gave a cash tip.

Next time I go back, someone (I'm assuming the same person) had put a very blatant piece of paper in front of their register, that says "Dear [app name] users, we're glad that you're enjoying your FREE (underlined and bolded and capitalized) cup of coffee. But we make a modest living so please don't forget to tip us". Wow. Really? It's one thing if the shop was giving the cups of coffee for free, but it wasn't.. it was some app company that was paying for the coffee.

Look, I'm not against tipping for coffee, especially if it's for things like a pourover that take some effort to make. I am, however, a believer that a tip should be given for good service. One doesn't go to restaurants and have the servers remind them, "Please leave me a tip because I served your food and I make a modest living". If that happened at a restaurant, that wouldn't fly.. so why should the case be different at a coffee shop? I still left a tip, but I felt such a bad vibe coming from this shop that it makes me not want to go back.
author: Kazu O.

description:
Hipster level 10 which therefore means good coffee. My almond milk capp for $3.50 was really strong and tasty and had latte art for instagramming. 

Wifi yes, good amount of seating include a few outdoor tables, little dim in there so maybe not for long hours of working.
author: Aria S.

description:
Felt completely judged when going in there bc I didnt match up to the hipster standards lol

But this place has very nice quality coffee and seriously the best poppyseed muffin I have ever eaten in my life!! Cute place for a photo opp and probably would come back if I was in the area.
author: Jordan S.

description: 3:30pm 8/28 standard Mission coffee shop, nothing special but if you're looking for a work space with outlets and decent coffee, this would be it. Went up to ask for a water refill and the cashier who was talking to a friend rolled her eyes and pretended not to see me standing there. Meh. It's the mission, so whatever
author: Lynn T.

description:
The award for best almond croissant and study spot in San Francisco goes to Stanza Coffee. Seriously, their almond croissants are delicious! Perfectly flakey exterior and soft (but not mushy) interior. And Stanza is a great study spot; there is plenty of seating, both indoor and outdoor, PLUS free wi-fi (which I don't feel like a lot of SF coffee shops offer, for whatever reason).

Not deserving of 5-stars (yet) because their almond latte was unusually bitter/burnt. Maybe next time!
author: Jennifer K.

description: Great coffee, nice atmosphere and super-friendly barista today. All they need are longer hours (5 pm? Really?) and some kind of discount on refills!
author: Geoffrey U.

description:
Cute, hipster cafe that serves hipster coffee.  What do I mean by hipster coffee? I mean this hipster SF obsession with "bright" lighter coffee roasts that translate into acidic in my mouth.  And also, they only have milk and almond milk.  Seemed strange to me that they did not have any soy milk, which to me is a more natural dairy alternative, but oh well.

I ordered a cappuccino and my brother ordered an espresso.  The cappuccino was good--held a nice latte art rose which suggests that the almond milk was foamed well and it was well balanced.  However, the espresso had no milk to cut the "brightness" of the coffee which turned into, as my brother described, what tasted like hot vinegar.  Yes, I understand that some coffee blends have some acidity but espresso should never be compared to vinegar in my opinion.
author: Jess Y.

description:
Pretty chill coffee shop in the busiest corner of Valencia.

This hole-in-the-wall coffee shop is certainly hipster/trendy, with coffee dripping machines, iPad cash registers, and cushioned armchairs. They also have a back balcony, which unfortunately was closed when I was there. There is also outside seating in the front, which was very, very nice, except there was a group of flies hovering around the entrance.

In terms of coffee quality, the iced coffee was generally ok--nothing to write home about. Not bad.

A lot of folks sit here with their laptops for long periods of time. Feels kind of like Haus, but with less lighting and seats.
author: Henry L.

description:
1. shaded outdoor seating
2. amazing iced mocha
3. friendly barista 
4. music isn't too loud
5. pastries look awesome
6. great location

after writing all this down... i'm upping their stars...
author: Vicki T.

description:
Shout out to the barista who is doing it right, and I regret not getting his name. Tall, dark hair, glasses. 

Patience pays here. Ordering a simple Cortado can be a blessing and a curse, the milk foam was perfection - dense & almost sweet. The espresso equal parts nutty & spice. Together? Totally balanced. Something some simple can EASILY go wrong, and this morning it went SO RIGHT. 

Not to mention, witnessing him remake a soy latte without being asked because the milk foam didn't come out right, adjusting his technique and remaking the latte left me thinking the foam was whole milk with the beautiful design he drew. But actually just a reflection for his care of the coffee craft. 

The. Best.
author: Jessa C.

description:
Good coffee. 
I can't figure out the vibe here. I mean, the coffee is good. The patio could be cleaned more often. But the vibe... I don't get it. I never know what to wear to this place. Is it  boho or  hip-chic or ... hat or no hat? I don't know!
The coffee is good. 

Bon appetit!
author: Dejana B.

description:
Stanza just oozes hipsterness from the moment you walk in. Plenty of vintage decor and huge cold drip towers that make it "IG worthy," haha. 

I was planning on getting their cold brew but they had ran out by the time we arrived so I opted for their pour over instead. It's a little more on the pricey side at $4 for a small cup but the flavors were quite bold and roasted the way I like it. 

From what I noticed, there was a good selection of other drinks as well such as cappuccinos and a French press in case you're looking for something a little stronger and flavorful.

Plenty of outlets here so you can ensure that your MacBook will have ample battery life. I didn't get a chance to hang out for long as we were a bit hungry and took a stroll to grab some pupusas around the corner!
author: Roger M.

description:
The Mission is blessed with a slew of coffee shops and one would think that it shouldn't be hard to find a peaceful corner to read a book in.

Wrong.

I went to at least 2 coffee shops in the area and almost gave up, until Stanza Coffee. 

The back patio is a refuge from the craziness (and crazies!) that is 16th st. The baristas could be a TAD friendlier, but I got my chai latte quickly, sat down and read my book. Wifi is complimentary for you folks who don't like talking to other people.
author: Janice C.

description: The coffee, hours and prices are still good, but the pastries have switched and the music has gotten a little elevatory. They also have a patio at the back which is nice to sit in on a good weather day.
author: Jasiah L.

description:
My review is in video and song!

author: Nando G.

description: Great not too loud off the beaten path spot to grab coffee or tea. The staff is always helpful and kind. Great for meetings. I do wish they had some air conditioning :)
author: Jared S.

description:
Gotta say that this place is DA BOMB! Went here on a Monday afternoon to meet a friend and they have the best tasting mocha I have ever tasted! Plus, the most awesomest part was that, unfortunately spilled my drink as soon as I walked out the door. Went back and told the barista what happened and totally replaced it! (free of charge!) 
You guys are awesome in every which way! Thank you again for great service and a great cup of Joe!  See you on the flip side.. I will be returning soon!
author: L G.

description:
Loved the decor inside.

$4 for iced tea?  An 8oz. jar?  A bit much for me . . . but, I'll come back for coffee!
author: S P.

description:
Really love this place. my almond milk latte was light and airy but still very flavorful. I have been here twice in the last month and have been impressed but visits. Will definitely come again.

I also like how it feels very open, it doesn't ever look super packed so you can come in and find a table, and their beans are good quality.

Do come by and visit...it's fantastic!
author: Monica J.

description:
I love coming here before working in the Mission.

Their coffee is on par with Blue Bottle and Ritual. But to be fair, I have only really had their lattes and mochas. 

I am addicted to their walnut chocolate chip cookie and their morning muffins aren't bad, either. I was a little disappointed at their raspberry tart, though. :'( It wasn't flaky enough for my tastes, and didn't taste as good as the other two. But I've still got so many other pastries to try!

*edit*

Gotta knock it down a star. They sell these ham and cheese pastries that are cold, and do not provide a microwave to heat them up. They say it tastes better without heat. I say, bullshit. It did not taste good at all.

I'll stick to the overall excellent coffee they have and the walnut choco cookie/ginger blueberry muffin.
author: June H.

description:
3.5 STARS.

I prefer the ice coffee here over Blue Bottle's, because it's less acidic and tart. My favorite is still the Philz Iced Mint Mojito ofcourse. They serve Mr. Holmes baked goods (like Linea Cafe), but I was kinda grossed out by all the fruit flies circling the food. 

FRENCH PRESS ($2.50) - 3 STARS:
Too sour for me. Your options are pour over ($4) or French Press. 

LATTE ($4.00) - 3.5 STARS:
They use a variety of different Ethiopian and other beans. The latte is rich and foam...super creamy. Didn't taste too much of espresso in fact. Cappucino - $3.50. I prefer Four Barrel, grand and rituals interpretation. 

MR. HOLMES BANANA DONUT ($3.50) - 3.5 STARS:
I can usually judge a pastry from its cover and I was certain I would like it. Right after ordering it I remembered I ordered the same exact thing at Linea and I had the same impression as the first time - it sounded and looked amazing, tasted pretty good (very soft and fresh), but was different than I expected and overall nothing mind blowing . The banana filling was pure mashed banana (not creamy like I expected) - it tasted fresh, not overly ripe. 

I would return to try their famous chocolate chip cookie!

The decor reminds me of Haus (on 24th) but dimmer, or Ma'velous but more ghetto. Free wifi and plenty of tables, including a few outdoors, but a bit dark.
author: Jess C.

description: Great coffee! Very friendly staff!!! Cute cozy interior and extremely clean restroom. Liked it so much, I went back a second time in the same day:-)
author: Heather Y.

description:
Saturday, 1:00 PM.

Quickie:
+ Drink/Food quality
+ Service
- Hygiene
+ Strong wi-fi signal
+ Atmosphere
+ Turnaround
+ Menu variety
* Layout

And then...?
Eccentric shop powered by friendly staff. I'll indulge in a cold brew and get some more work done here.
author: Chuck N.

description: Very cool place. It was cold today so we kept the front door closed. My latte was great, and the Asian covers of Fleetwood Mac on the speakers were great.
author: Mike L.

description:
Lovely ambiance, good coffee, friendly baristas. Seating is comfortable if you're on the booth.

For a while the only sites I could access on their wifi, from both my phone and laptop, were google/facebook, until it resolved itself suddenly after one hour. I still don't know why.
author: Connie L.

description:
Wifi only works for email and chat.  

If you need to do work in dashboards or do research on sites, they wont work as Stanza only whitelists certain domains.
author: Youareming ..

description:
Eclectic, hipster coffee shop minutes away from the 16th St BART station. Equipped with a simple, but comprehensive menu and a variety of pastries, there is something for everyone at Stanza. 

I really wanted to try their cappuccino, but alas it was late afternoon when I walked in so I opted for a thai iced tea instead. Surprisingly, It was hands down the best thai iced tea I've ever had. Ever. And I've had  my fair share of thai iced teas. Somehow Stanza got the perfect milk to tea ratio. The sweetness of the drink was perfect, not overbearing like every other thai iced tea I've ever had. It also came out in under a minute, presented adorably in a mason jar. 

The coffee shop itself has a lot of seating inside, in the front patio, and in the back patio, each location with its own atmosphere almost. The inside is dimly lit, minimalist, and displays local art - perfect for getting some work done (tip: wifi code is on the blackboard to the left of the counter). The front patio is perfect for people watching, and the back is great for conversation. 

All together a very well rounded cafe! I will definitely be back to try the espresso drinks.
author: Umeet S.

description: This is only for coffee to go-- I find their cold brew a little bitter but I like that. Their cappuccinos are wonderful-- their location and ambience are unbeatable, every time I go in I want to grab a book and sit down which is a good thing! Excited to return after a couple of times of just grabbing a drink to go :)
author: Rebecca L.

description: The artwork on the walls is interesting, and the shop itself is comfortable. However, the coffee is bitter, and there are dogs inside. Is that legal in norcal? Because it's not in socal.
author: Lisa S.

description: Delicious cortado!! Beautiful place. The service was great. Sadly, the open space is under construction.
author: Juliana A.

description:
Cool little coffee shop with very nice ambiance. Nice place to hang out.

I just don't like their coffee that much. 

I guess I have been brain washed by Starbucks and Blue Bottle into liking their style of coffee.
author: David T.

description: Great, small coffee bar. Iced coffee was delicious-- so smooth, not at all acidic/bitter like most others I've had. Friendly staff. Wifi, outlets. Plus played Britney Spears' original album songs-- BONUS!
author: J. A.

description:
With 2-3 hours to kill before heading to the airport, I was looking for a coffee shop where I could park it and work for a while. After reading reviews of lots of other places, it didn't seem like I'd ever find a place WITHOUT pretentious baristas, tiny tables, and horribly overpriced drinks...until Yelp led me to Stanza. Yay! Bonus points that it was very easily accessible by BART (16th & Mission) and only a few blocks from the station, so I didn't have to lug around my bags too far.

Two of my must-haves for a coffee shop to make it on my "traveling office" list is that there's reliable wifi and plenty of outlets available: Stanza's got both. I also enjoyed that the tables are a decent size per person -- sometimes tables for 1 or 2 people are miniature, with barely enough room to fit one laptop, let alone two. These were decent sized tables with enough room to spread out a laptop and all of my other stuff. 

The barista was friendly, greeted me as soon as I came up to the counter, and had my cappuccino ready fairly quickly. 5 stars for the cappuccino alone; it's one of my top 3 that I've ever had. One of the staff even came around with free cookies before I left. Woohoo!

I was there on a weekday morning/early afternoon so it wasn't too crowded. In fact, I felt right at home hanging out with about 6-8 other folks who had been working there all morning: Usually, I'm wary of ever leaving my stuff alone at a coffee shop (ie. whenever I need a bathroom break) but I didn't have any problems doing so here. 

Can't wait to come back!
author: Kathy S.

description:
I stopped by here for a quick coffee break with a colleague. It's a bit dark once you step inside, but I thought this added to the relaxed atmosphere. They have a small (but tasty!) selection of pastries by the register. I ordered a cranberry orange scone and a chocolate walnut cookie, and both really hit the spot on a Monday morning. There is also a really cute outdoor area in the back with lots of tables and comfy chairs. I could definitely see myself chilling outside with some friends on a warm day.

Only thing that I didn't like was that the wait for our drinks was a bit long. There was only one order ahead of us, so I didn't understand why it took them so long.
author: Robia L.

description:
I was looking for a place that had great wifi to do some work... Too few of these in the mission. 

Anyway, I found this cafe through Yelp and decided to try it out. Good wifi, decent latte, but it just doesn't seem like the owner gave much thought in designing the space. Don't think I will be back again.
author: Crystal W.

description: Good place to do some work with nice staff. The atmosphere is very chill. I like coffee here but it's slightly sour. They also have a patio at the back which is nice to sit in on a good weather day.
author: Kamden B.

description: Nice atmosphere, but terrible wifi and my chai latte was not good at all. Came here to work, but the wifi is so bad I won't come back again unless I was reading a book or something. Not good for working.
author: Alexis Lynn E.

description:
When I need a fancy coffee, Stanza is my go to choice in the inner Mission neighborhood. Today I savored a cup of Lord Windsor brand Brazilian, smooth, with notes of fudge and toasted peanut butter n jelly sandwich.

The decor is a mix of Moroccan chic and funky. There's a sunny patio out back where I can catch up on my work via the free WiFi.

The barrister was friendly and good looking too.
author: Jim J.

description:
This place is the definition of hipster.

The guy working at the counter had a super laid back hipster vibe, but he seemed a bit annoyed when my friends and I took a while to order. All of us got cappuccinos and lattes and found all of our drinks to be quite strong. I typically get soy milk for my cappuccinos, but Almond Milk was the only milk alternative they had so I went with that.

There was a decent amount of seating both inside and outside on worn down antique looking couches. Seems like a decent place to camp out and work!
author: Anna M.

description:
If only more of the folks who work here were actually nice...

I've been a very regular customer at Stanza. The place has character, ample seating, an outdoor patio from some dystopian future (ripped couches, one failing umbrella, scorching sunshine) and quality coffee/tea choices.

But the employees in general are just not that nice. Don't get me wrong. They're not mean - I'm not claiming velvet rope level disdain. It's simply that there are a half dozen quality coffee shops within a few block radius with similar attributes yet with employees who make eye contact, say "welcome" and appear genuinely pleased to serve a customer. At Stanza, (with one female barista as an exception who's name I sadly don't know) I'm lucky to receive a responding grunt when I walk up, say "how are you" & wait for some sort of acknowledgement before requesting my latte. The only warmth the employees seem to have is for one another and freezing temperatures are reserved for anyone arrogant enough to pay for something. 

Sorry Stanza - Craftsman and Wolves, Borderland, Church Street Cafe, Flying Pig Bistro and Bernie's are getting my 4-5 visits per week.

p.s. It's not just me. :) I was open to the possibility but have watched too many people endure similar treatment.
author: Jonathan L.

description: I got a regular drip coffee here to-go, and I thought it was a-okay. It had a full body, and it was pretty dark. I will be sure to try the latte next time (this is how I usually judge a coffee place), but for now, I will give this place a solid 3 stars. I remember the ambiance being kind of dark, but it would be a good place to get some work done or to read or to catch up with someone.
author: Steph V.

description: vey laid back, chill, intimate interior -- great tunes planing in the background, decently sized patio. came here the other day to meet up with a friend and catch up over coffee, and this was the perfect spot- very friendly barista, people were working on their laptops, and i tried their fresh-squeezed orange juice-- so good. will definitely return here to do work from my laptop!
author: Haley D.

description: After walking by the ridiculous line at Four Barrel coffee on a sunny Saturday morning, we walked into Stanza with no line and only ONE option for decaf coffee: hot Americano. :( Since I'm cutting back on my caffeine intake, I still like the taste of coffee and just went with the hot beverage. The shop is small and with little to no air circulation even with the back and front doors open. On the plus side, if you're able to snag an outdoor seat in their back patio, then it's worth another visit.
author: Lisa R.

description:
This place is awesome.  The outdoor seating, the coffee, the people, all amazing.
I wish I could downvote some of the negative reviews.  If you think the baristas aren't friendly enough, you're a pussy.
author: Chicken L.

description: I had the worst lemonade ever there.When we just asked about its taste, the person just took my glasses very very rudely and said that's your problem!! Never had an experience like that in while!! Everything in the menu was really pricey comparing to the quality and quantity! Never go back!
author: Faranak K.

description:
Stanza Coffee carries de la paz coffee as well as other beans. store length room for comfort, patio in the back too. relaxing atmosphere.

brew: de la paz, french press(2.5)
-4 minutes freshly made, 12 oz?
-not as smooth as other  de laz brews
3.5 stars.
author: Victor G.

description:
Love hot chocolate here
Nice environment and music
Some time the table is not available
author: Namtan A.

description:
I was trying to figure out why Stanza felt so familiar to me, until I realized I'd been to their Haight location before. The Mission location one is, relatively speaking, much nicer, if only because it's roomier, and has much more, and usable, seating. And by usable, I mean conventional tables, rather than the visually appealing, but hard-to-use barrel top tables at the other location.

In any case, coming here for a user experience interview with a local startup, I was treated to one of Stanza's sea salt caramel doughnuts. And, well... DAMN that was one tasty doughnut. Basically, take a large jelly doughnut, and replace the jelly with a nicely balanced caramel sauce. Not too overwhelming, as sea salt usually is, with the salt offering a nice balance for an otherwise normally too-sweet pastry.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - While this location IS larger than the Haight location, it's still more of a mid-size cafe than a large one. Seating, if I recall, runs mostly along the walls, with enough space to get to and from the door to the counter. Seating, as mentioned previously, is comprised of conventional tables.

Bathroom - No comment because I didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Okay cafe, but not really on the top of my list. I'd probably only come back as an alternative to the busier, more crowded cafes.

The place is a pretty hipster, hole-in-the-wall cafe that I wouldn't have normally noticed if it weren't for Yelp. Not a bad place to chill and work or hang out with people. It's not big, but there's a good amount of tables and seating (indoors and outdoors) as well as outlets and free wifi. 

Their coffee prices are pretty standard. I had a CAPPUCCINO ($3.50), but it left a slightly sour aftertaste that I didn't like. But on the plus side, they have unsweetened almond milk as a dairy substitute at NO EXTRA CHARGE! :)

The main reason I'm turned off by this cafe though is the lack of cleanliness. There was a mass of flies just circling around near the door, and the bathroom smells like a hobo/pee-infested Bart station..
author: Jessie L.

description:
This used to be an awesome place to hang out. Staff was great, coffee was excellent. But the new owners have made some poor decisions as of lately. There has been an infestation of cockroaches and rats in the cafe and front entrance that has not been addressed for months. The coffee is no longer rotated, and the quality of their product has diminished greatly. 

On top of all that, the general cleanliness of the cafe is poor; the bathroom is constantly out of toilet paper and soap, and there's always trash and debris all over the floor. 

I've always been a big supporter of local businesses, but there are a number of better coffeeshops right down the street from this location (I.e., Four Barrel/Ritual). Don't waste your time/money here.
author: Robert R.

description:
It was one of the random coffee  place my friend and i went to when we hung out in the mission district few days ago. 

Not much selections of drinks to pick from. The drink i got was Elderflower osmanthus tea (i got it more like ice tea since it was a nice day) for $3. The price was decent for a medium side cup to go. They have the glass bottle looking cup for those who want to drink in. This drink is light and floral. Thats how i usually like to drink my 

When i came, there no line so i didnt have to wait that long to get my drink after ordering it. The seatings area: which includes main seating area inside and front and back outdoor seatings (in case you like to seat in the sun/fresh air). Almost all the tables was taken but manage to squeeze for a table in the back.
author: Julie N.

description:
I heart coffeeeeeee! This cafe is set a little back from the street, which is nice. There's plenty of seating in the calm cozy space, and you can watch the sweetheart barista make your drank. I opted for my usual, a cappuccino. Definitely hit the spot, though I would have liked it to be hot and not lukewarm.. it was cold out!

Just now realizing there's a back patio here. Must come back.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Came for the wifi but the connection just Doesn't Work... The bartender was helpful and provided an alternative but in the end I still couldn't get connection.

The coffee on the other hand was pretty good.
author: Nicholas H.

description: Patio closed on a Sunday afternoon and $4.50 for a small iced coffee. Too many better places to choose from in this area. Fail :(
author: Mana B.

description:
Hipster much? Well it's San Francisco, I should've known better. 

I tried to order a skinny late, but they only had 2% milk. Like come on no skim milk for God's sake! Whatever... Got the 2% late, came well designed in a beautiful cup but tasted horrible, one sip and I was done. Maybe because I'm not used to 2 % milk and found it too heavy or maybe it was bad in general, I don't know... 

The place  actually looks kinda cool, the music though can get on your nerves that God for my headphones and Norah Jones on repeat. The internet is beyond slow. Nothing would open. I couldn't do any of my work, the late wasn't good, so I packed and left!
author: Tamara S.

description: Solid cafe with two cool Taiwanese cold drip machines. The place is small and was packed, including their small patio. The guy working didnt seem too enthused but still got my iced coffee right quick. If it werent stuffed id definitely hang outside if the weather was nice. Intellingentsia coffee is a bonus
author: Kim N.

description: The moment you walk into Stanza, you'll know the coffee here is good. It's a little dark for a cafe but I absolutely love the edgy, today is a fresh start feel it induces. I got the cappuccino and it was just as I imagined. Perfect to the core!
author: Vivian W.

description:
I prefer Four barrel since it is on my way to bart, but the line is always crazy long in the mornings. Stanza, on the other hand, only a half a block out of the way, has NO line in the mornings, which is awesome! Unfortunately, their lattes aren't as tasty and the service is slower since it's 1 man taking your order and making your drink. I ordered a pastry as well and ended up giving it to a homeless girl. 

I do like sitting here and enjoying a latte and working on my laptop too. So this place is definitely better than mediocre, ambiance considered.
author: Angela L.

description: Stanza is a great place to go when you want decent coffee and have work to get done, but don't want to deal with crowds of hipsters flooding the more popular coffee shops (i.e Ritual, Four barrel, etc). Stanza is in a quaint little spot and has a lot of seating. I like this location more than the Haight St. location, but I've found that my cappuccinos have been a little too acidic for my liking. Will I return? Probably out of convenience but I can't say that it's up to par with its fellow Mission roasteries.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Cool and hip place to hang and chill.. I tried the mocha and I cannot complain, not to strong it was just the right flavor... 
The only thing probably I didn't like it was the Mosquitos flying around the bread hopefully is not like that all the time..
author: Gloria T.

description:
Great little coffee shop in the Mission. Not as popular as four barrel or any of the crazy trendy spots. I'm still not sure exactly why people come from all over the world to drink a cup of $6 coffee, but whatever.

They have delicious drip coffee. They also have espresso drinks, but the drip coffee is the specialty. My personal favorite is the cold brew coffee. Iced coffee is so 1999 compared to cold brew. FYI - if you haven't had it you can't add any milk or creamer. It's most delicious plain...it's all about the true flavor of the coffee.

Atmosphere - Stanza has a fair amount of seating. A few seats are outdoors in the front and the remainder are inside. Cute decor, simple and hipster-ish. 

Food - they have pastries, but no prepared food.

Summary - great neighborhood coffee spot. Perfect place to stop in the morning before hopping on the Bart at 16th and Mission.
author: Juliet S.

description:
Great, quality cup of coffee. Cool, hip, dark grungy environment with mostly hard metal type music playing while I was there, making it a little hard to work without headphones.

Upside was that it never got too crowded, there were plentiful plugs, decent wifi, and always an open table to sit.

Would probably not be the best place to take someone you want to impress / high maintainence / a business meeting. Definitely somewhere to take your hipster friends to impress.
author: Alice Z.

description: They brew your coffee individually (cup by cup) when you order it by manually pouring hot water on top of grinds through a filter that sits on top of the cup. The water temperature appears to be controlled as well as the brewing time. Pretty neat!
author: Leo M.

description: Love the mocha here! I like how Stanza is never empty, but also never too crowded to the point that you can't find a place to sit. The wifi is also reliable. I agree with a previous review that the baristas could be a little bit friendlier, but being from NYC I don't mind the no-nonsense attitude.
author: Claudia C.

description: Coming from a coffee nerd, I totally fell in love with Stanza. They use Slayer Machines (known for prestige in the coffee world). The barista was friendly and there were interesting art displays. There's free WIFI which everyone can appreciate. I got the single origin espresso, the Ethiopian option and it was delightful. I would highly recommend for any visitors who like coffee!
author: Diane M.

description: Hold the phones. This might be my favorite hole in the wall coffee shop in SF.  Since I've turned into a seriously early riser, I've taken it upon myself to explore SF's coffee shops that are open early and getting in my coffee fix before the world wakes up.  Stanza is right off the 16th Street BART station, which made this horribly convenient for me coming from the Embarcadero.  In walking in at around 7:30AM, there was myself and one other person, and I was warmly greeted by one of the most friendliest human beings behind the counter.  I was set on having a pour over, and after talking with my newfound friend, I went with his favorite: beans from Topeca Coffee from Tulsa, OK. I also threw in a bran muffin for good measure.  For anyone that hates on the fact that this place doesn't roast their own beans, save it. Similar to my experience at Mazarine, I love the idea of bringing in new roasters and exposing people like myself to new blends and varieties from other parts of the country (other parts of the US know how to roast beans too, you know!). After sitting with my warm cup of coffee, my delicious bran muffin (which was absolutely delish that day and the day after), I concluded that Stanza is a place that I'd like to keep for myself.  It was incredibly relaxing just sitting and enjoying some coffee on a fine SF morning and an amazing way to start off my day.  I shall return Stanza, thank you for making my Wednesday so awesome.
author: Lisa I.

description:
I love my hipster coffee minus the hipster snarky attitude.

Oh, I also like Stanza because it's not just whole or almond milk. I mean really Four Barrel, WHOLE MILK? GTFOOH that is some Paula Deen dairy. 

Interesting space. I like the outdoor area in the front. Perfect for sunny mornoons in the Mission. If that doesn't float your boat then perhaps the dark interior (fairly quiet inside) or the outdoor patio in the back.

Friendly staff and great coffee selection. YUM
author: Susy C.

description:
Absolutely ridiculous. 

This place is like a punchline for the absurdity of present-day San Francisco. 

$4.00 for the smallest cup of coffee I have ever purchased. I go to cafés all over the city and this one is the most absurd. 

Take your business to Rodger's or Philz for this price. Way better coffee, service, staff, and size.
author: Michael P.

description: I had a coffee that was the pour over type.  The service was quick and friendly.  I tasted a cookie which was also quite tasty.  The decor has that coffee shop vibe.  The coffee hit the morning spot.
author: Andy S.

description:
Soy is their only non-dairy option (pouty face), so I ordered a soy latte and sat down to charge my iPhone. Let me note the irony of having something called a Smart Phone that needs to be plugged in constantly... but anyway. Back to the review!

This is one of those plain Jane kind of cafes. Nothing really stood out. I saw that they brew Four Barrel coffee, which is a pretty solid choice. 

They were faintly playing some Pink Floyd when I walked in, which I appreciated. To me, there is something strange about going to a coffee shop in which the only sound filling the room is the clicking of laptop keys. It's a little eerie, but something I have come to expect (mostly in college towns like Berkeley). I guess I just prefer when my coffee haunts have a bit more personality. The baristas seemed a little glum, as well. 

Stanza does offer an outdoor patio that might be a cozy place to chat with a friend or enjoy the sun. You know, when the weather isn't so nippy. 

My soy latte was tasty, but I've had better. The latte art was well executed, although a friend that saw my photo commented that it was slightly phallic (I don't see it?).
author: Brandi W.

description:
I feel such at home here. Stanza is the epitome of what I look for in a hipster coffee joint. Everything from the dimly lit interior to the whole space made of black/grey/wood to the artisan coffee that they serve. The front heated patio makes it very welcoming to just hang for a while. 

The barista that helped us out was awesome. Super nice with recommendations and even opened up the back patio for my bud and I to just hang... and hang we did. 

I ordered the cappuccino (as I always do on my first visit to any hipster coffee joints) and my bud ordered herself a macchiato. I didn't have any of hers, but my cappuccino was dead on. Nice bold aroma with a hell of a balance of milk. 

WORD OF ADVICE: Check out their pastries!
author: Mike D.

description:
One of my favorite coffee houses.  Usually not too busy, coffee is good (though i prefer 4 barrel).  
My only con is the music is usually too loud making studying or converstaion a bit tough.  I wish it as quieter with the music more background than foreground.
author: Dj S.

description:
Loved the seating in the back and the presentation of the drinks. A great place to go on a lazy Saturday or to get some work done during the week. 

Very pleasant and inviting interior and friendly staff.
author: Marilyn M.

description:
You can't go wrong with coffee besides being out of it at a coffee shop.  How can a coffee shop run out of coffee?!

Since they ran out of coffee, we ordered up the iced cold Americano instead.

It's good - especially on a warm, sunny San Francisco day! 

They have a nice outside lounge area in the back and in front of this place as well. 

Wifi is complimentary too!

It's a pleasant chit chat over coffee here.  Only if they don't run out of it!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
This is a great spot for coffee!  The coffee is good, the service is friendly and quick, and the ambiance is warm and welcoming.

This afternoon was sunny and warm, and I enjoyed an iced coffee sitting in Stanza'a covered front patio - it was a perfect little break.
author: Barnali D.

description: Bougie coffee place with a nicely-decorated interior and outdoor patio seating in the back. Definitely recommend rushing to a shaded spot if in the backyard; otherwise, the sun can be brutal! They also have cool couches/booths (?), but one of them is kind of busted. Avoid! Otherwise, seems like a great spot to enjoy some coffee and free wi-fi. :p
author: Shendi X.

description:
Gibraltar Review

The Pour:
Pretty good overall. When I was there they used a couple of different sources for their beans (they didn't roast their own)

Service:
Friendly and skilled baristas

Ambiance:
Dark but comfortable, they have an area out back to sit too.

Conclusion:
Strangely, AFAIK it's the only artisan coffee shop in San Francisco that has WiFi, although that might be because Pork Store Cafe lets them share theirs. Other than that it's a very solid cafe. Light roast like most of San Francisco. To be honest, I usually go to Four Barrel which is a couple blocks away, but it's not a bad place to go.

About Me / Review Criteria:
-I only check out / review "Third Wave"/artisan/craft coffee shops
-Nobody gets more than 4 stars until I've gone several times
-Reviews can't be based on just a select group of baristas, they all have to be equally skilled, or at least must all have a minimum level of skill
-My star ratings are solely based on the drink, never on food, ambiance, or if the barista is emo or snobby (because that would bring down more than 50% of the shops), although I do mention those in the review
-I don't claim to be a trained coffee connoisseur but I know the difference between good and bad coffee
-My reviews are generally based on cappuccinos (or gibraltars), not espresso or drip coffee
author: Bernard F.

description: I stopped in for a quick caffeine reup and was pleasantly greeted and served (and complimented) by the kind barista. I ordered a chai and suddenly had a chocolate craving so I asked if they made s chocolate chai, which my barista replied, "not usually, but I don't see why not!" Then happily made me a delicious chocolatey chai that gave me the smiles all the way to my next errand! Will def come back to try other things when I'm in SF.
author: Akasha O.

description: It's a cool place to work or hang out for a while. There is not much variety to their coffee beans (which I actually liked). Considering that they buy their beans from local shops, and that the beans are not their own, the prices are a bit high. However, the atmosphere, the pour-over, and the good quality beans make up for it.
author: Ashkan H.

description: I mean it's a cute hipster coffee shop in the mission. One of many, but they have nice wifi and play good music. Well interesting music so if you're interesting you'll like it. And I know you're interesting you Yelp user you.
author: Erin W.

description: The decaf tastes like regular and is a great get outta work treat. A quiet coffee shop with an outdoor patio, as well.
author: Mel G.

description: Really bummed to see this place go downhill as it used to be a favorite spot! The pastries-- which were formerly from Mission Beach Cafe--have been replaced with some unpalatable, Costco quality offerings. Similarly, they've swapped out their incredible Turning Point coffee for overdeveloped blends (unsure what roaster) that are more akin to Starbucks than anything you would expect from a reputable San Francisco coffee house. I've heard rumors of new ownership, but I'm unsure why the management seems determined to make this into a forgettable, third-rate establishment. Truly a waste of a great space with such potential.
author: Rob L.

description: The cold brew coffee is really sour and has a terrible after taste, the warm coffee isn't much better but it's a bit more bearable. No matter how much sugar I put in the cold brew I can't dull the bitter taste. The chai tea is decent.
author: Maddie F.

description:
Great coffee and shop! I love the cold brew at stanza, it's really strong. I've also had espresso drinks here and love them. I'm a coffee fanatic, and this is definitely one of my favorite spots in the city. Stanza always has a great array of pastries in the morning from local bakeries.

Unfortunately I have to knock down a star for the ambiance - I don't dig the darkness of the location, and I don't enjoy sitting in there.
author: Lauren G.

description:
(See pics) Review #1343. These people are serious about making a cup of coffee in a very friendly sense. When asked what was the difference between French Press and Single Drip, they will tell you about how French Press can give you more sediment (complex flavor), oil (flavor not lost), taste (how you can taste the physical structure with your palate.)

They also have different beans all over the world for the drink and for sale. This gives you a different dimension and appreciation of the beans based on the weather condition, as well as roasting process, so you know every cup will be different, yet have specific characteristics you are looking for.

The name sounded familiar and I had been wondering if it was owned by the same folks over at Stanza on Haight. We finally made a visit and yes, it's by the same friendly and knowledgeable cool people.

The darker non-laminated wood tone floor with smooth benches and some bamboo style chairs were all nature feel. Patrons were laid back but more techie feel than those at Four Barrel.
author: T L.

description:
The dude who gave me this tea and crumpet is a nicely spirited fella. 

I have bought myself a cup of tea (elder leaf) and an apricot poppyseed muffin. 

I am thoroughly impressed with the muffin.

This place may come off as a corporate snub hut, but I may vouch for its candid simplicity. 

There is an air of focus and dignity. 

A fine experience, indeed.
author: Fenua I.

description: Hot mocha was so good.. Like there music and coffeemaker made me throw back to Brooklyn :)
author: Nichapatr P.

description:
Coffee's totally A-OK, the vibe is awesome, but the service leaves me wanting a little more. It's been 50/50 with me-  great, friendly service with awesome recommendations on some occasions, and smug, too-good-to-acknowledge you super-hipsters the rest. Maybe I'm just catching the grumpy ones too early in the morning, but come on, crack a smile.

Great pour overs, great non-local coffees (what up Intelligentsia), and really, very skilled baristas. The patio area's a cool plus for those warmer days.
author: Colleen M.

description:
This place is more like 3.5 stars...

Great space....  Grey and a little dim, but cozy.  If San Francisco had rainy days, I'd come straight here, with a book in hand (and a head lamp).

My chai latte is amazing, and it pretty much makes up for the complete lack of greeting upon entering.  This barista is just too cool for conversation.

There's free wifi, but it's a little dark for getting things done on paper.  

Price range as only one $ because your coffee will be under $10, sure...  But $4-5 for a coffee could probably make the $$ rating, considering it's only a beverage.
author: Valerie T.

description: Friendly people, high quality coffee, and a backyard patio with full round booth seating. What's not to like? Perfect spot to hang at when you're waiting for someone to meet you near 16th and Mission BART, or if you're early for your train :)
author: Eliza D.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE. I rarely give 5-star reviews, but Stanza Coffee is just one of those places that warms my heart. 

I stumbled upon this place a few months ago while leaving the Tapas place a few doors down. I was craving coffee, and this placed look decent enough. 

What I stumbled upon was a great coffee shop with awesome/nice baristas and some of the BEST coffee I've had in SF. I even remember what kind of coffee I got on my first visit - Ethiopia Kochere. So yummy. 

After that first good experience, I went back and brought my computer with me. They have a lot of tables/chairs, and a patio out back. Stanza is such a chill place, and the people that go there a lot are not douchey or anything, even though the place might come off that way (I think that was initial reaction when I first went there). 

Anyway, I highly recommend this place if you want a delicious cup of coffee and maybe want to sit there on your computer for a few hours, or maybe even meet up with a friend. 

Note: There was one week when I would go every day. I love(d) it that much.
author: Arnold B.

description: This place was so so dark, but it still seemed a bit grimey in spite of my inability to actually see any dirt. The patrons were definitely intimidatingly hipsterish, but the staff were friendly. Still, I didn't want to sit in this cave and work for a full day. The outlets near my seat weren't working, so that wasn't much of an option anyway. Good coffee though- wish I'd gotten it to go.
author: M R.

description:
So I walk in looking for a table. Tell me why there are a few free ones in the front stacked with dirty dishes. Fine. I'll use the patio. Can't expect just anyone to buss a table. 

I order a Thai iced tea and look into the pastry cabinet. I wish I were making this up, but there were several gnats crawling over the remaining croissants. I asked the barista to throw it away. He says: "They are harmless." 

Right, so those gnats don't move from the bacterial contaminated trash to the pastries...? At least that's what the restaurant safety class taught me a few years back. 

And an easy way to get rid of them? Apple cider vinegar in an open cup with a drop of dish detergent. But of course the barista would rather ignore nastyness and smoke a cigarette out back. 

#hipsterratchet
author: Robert B.

description:
In the mission..gahh.. where I find safety is actually inside Stanza Coffee. 

I love that hipster feel, with the staff. Maybe not so friendly, but you everyone has their days right? Their pastries are soooo yummy and they have yummy coffee.

I come in here to use their wifi and work early in the mornings and in late afternoons. They have these cute little booths for one.
author: Mimi T.

description:
When Stanza opened, they only offered french press for a non-espresso drink. I am mixed on french press. Sometimes it is great, sometimes it is burned, sometimes grinds are floating around in my coffee.

After a few months, I have returned. To my delight, they now have a simple batch brew. Great idea! The pastries are the normal selection. The vibe is mellow. The creamer container is weird. (I know this seems cool and kitschy, but it is small, meaning it will run out and require refilling way more ofter - which involves a customer butting into another order to request a refill)

The tables and seats are already kind of junky. It isn't really bad yet. But I suspect the place will be on the level of Philz (best coffee, junky interior) or Muddy Waters in no time.  I don't need luxury. But run down is unpleasant.

!!!And the big complaint!!!  WHY KEEP IT FREEZING? You are trying to make it a cozy coffee shop. But you prop the door open so it is ~60 degrees. I am watching the steam from someone's freshly poured coffee being pushed by the wind (BY THE WIND) coming in the door. That drink, like mine, will be cold in 3 minutes and my toes numb in 12.

The cold is a plague of coffee shops and bars in this town. Maybe pouring coffee (or mixing drinks) makes you warm. But sitting at your tables makes me freezing.
author: Ben V.

description: I'd definitely come back for the Ice Mocha Coffee. Plus, there is free, unlimited wi-fi so it's a good cafe spot for those who want to sit longer and work with a laptop.
author: Shanice C.

description: The coffee is decent, but selection is small, prices are high because it's drip, and it's super hipster. You're pretty much paying for ambiance at this point because their coffee isn't their own. Free wi-fi, decent amount of room to sit, and bamboo/straw stools. You do get to see a giant drip machine though? Nothing else to write home about.
author: Danny C.

description: Awesome place to work out of with reliable and fast wi-fi. Awesome coffee and a very good atmosphere. Lightning is perfect. The only downside is that it is rather small, so most of the time you have to wait for a spot. This can be a problem if you are trying to get some work done and need an outlet spot. Seats are comfortable.
author: Wilson P.

description: Love this place. The almond croissants are bomb. The tea is delish. Espresso is rock solid.
author: Jen H.

description: Saved me in the mission where I was in a cofee craze and most of the places are cash only. Really cute place with a back patio. Cofee was good too
author: Suna L.

description: Great pastries and atmosphere but today's service was just subpar. I stood at the register for a few minutes while there were no other customers. One employee was chatting it up with someone else and the other was in the back. If you see me and I am standing there the least thing you could've done was greet and acknowledge me. When I finally was served, the employee was a bit rude.
author: Sharon Y.

description: Don't go to Stanza-It's one of the few places I know to get excellent coffee without waiting in a huge ass line!
author: Brian S.

description: Great spot for high end coffee.  Carefully curated collection of small pastries. Dark and sultry ambience with backyard patio and front semi outdoor seating. There is an amazing Moroccan door leading into the coffee shop.
author: M S.

description: Cute back patio, convenient location, friendly if rather useless baristas, weak-ass Wi-Fi. I just paid $8 for a cold (!) pour-over and godawful cookie that turned out to be vegan (WTF!). The baristas (who couldn't actually explain anything on the pretentious coffee menu) made sympathetic sad faces as I spat both fails out and returned to dribbling tepid water through filters. For $8 I should at least be able to surf the net.
author: Faith A.

description:
Great coffee and service.
Limited choices on treats if you come later in the day.
Downside is that it can be packed, but you're in the mission, so what do you expect? They have outdoor seating tho, which is nice.
author: Nathalie N.

description: Had a really good almond milk latte here today. Also the service is insanely friendly, as five minutes after leaving I realized I'd left my phone there. They were super understanding and helped me find it.
author: Leticia G.

description: This spot in Mission is very nice. Sometimes you need some time to get a coffee but it is great. Location and people are nice.
author: Angie A.

description: Definitely worth going to if you're in the area.  Great quality coffee, but comfortable seating is limited. Has a good sized outdoor area though in the back.
author: Ben S.

description: No surprise -- really good coffee. It was very strong: a latte had about the same amount of boldness as what I normally get in a cappuccino. Not a bad thing...
author: Andrew S.

description:
I've been coming here every Friday for the past few weeks for a meeting and I really like the place. The service is great, the same barista has served me three weeks in a row and he's always extremely friendly. 

I've only tried the cappuccino, but I don't think much of the coffee because I like mine piping hot and it's usually lukewarm (I keep forgetting to ask, though). My favorite part of this cafe is the latte art. The barista is literally excited when you order so he can draw something in your drink. 

It's a great place to study or hang with friends, especially on a sunny day. They have a great patio in the back with couches and tables. Maybe if you're lucky like me, you'll get to see someone painting a mural on the back wall!
author: Estelle C.

description:
Need to get away from the hustle and bustle of the mission and get some work done? Stanza's your best bet. 

Only a handful of items on their menu, but I didnt mind. The barista recommended their Iced Mocha since it was a warm day in the Mission. I gladly received it! It was bold in flavor, perfect mix of espresso and chocolate. refreshing! I also tried their macaroon, pretty sweet even for my tooth but pairing it with the iced mocha helped. I'll pass on it next time. 

Clean, modernly decorated, comfy booths, outlets if needed. It's calm, not crowded. People there drop in and out for a quick drink, or are like me... wanting to get work done in a hip/chill spot. 

Lots of places to grab a meal or drinks around, it's the mission! It's always live. 

I very much enjoyed my time here and look forward to coming back!
author: Millie Mae H.

description:
Holy shit. Best chai I've ever had.


I've worked for major coffee retailers before and smaller shops (where chai was either a concentrate, a powder, or syrup)..but they steep REAL quality chai here with not too much milk and it was PERFECT. 

I happened upon this place while waiting for my bf to get off work and needed to kill time. Everyone in here has long hair, glasses, and a respect for SILENCE and personal space (something I don't see too often in many cafes).

bonus: the baristas are  very informative and the playlist is on point!
author: Savanna W.

description:
Good service 
Beginner-level technique with making a pour over. Can't stress enough they need to train their staff how to do this properly.
author: David P.

description:
This place is awesome - no frills fantastic coffee. Great varied selection of beans (last I went, Coava from Portland, and a roaster from Denver). Very fast wifi for free. Ample Seating. Totally unpretentious vibe.

And the baristas are good. Really good.

As a visitor and coffee aficionado, I hit up all the big players - Blue Bottle, Four Barrel, Ritual, Philz, Sightglass. But my cup from Stanza was my favorite.
author: Shervin J.

description:
Really like this place, 

Coffee is awesomely good, waiters are nice and the place is quite cute. They have an outdoor patio that is amazing when it's sunny in SF.

However, they would definitely gain if the patio was cleaned (tables and seating are often dirty) - the reason for the only star down :)
author: Margaux M.

description:
This place is cool.

Free wifi, good coffee, lots of seating indoor and outdoor.

Went to Four Barrel first but ventured here after (because of the free wifi) and will definitely be back. 

oh, and they're wifi password is I love bacon. Was pretty much sold after that.
author: Kalani B.

description: I wanted to like this place, but I didn't. I get that this place is supposed to be sort of grunge, but it's actually disgusting. All I could think while using the restroom was, "When was the last time someone scrubbed this sink or toilet?" It could still have that same vibe, but be more hygienic. The indoor decor was otherwise nice. The seating outside feels like you're sitting on furniture dumped in a back alley. The coffee wasn't to my liking either. My friend and I threw ours away and went somewhere else. -_-
author: Adrianna A.

description:
Wonderfully unpretentious and yet niche coffee shop. The folks who work here are truly enthusiastic about unique coffees and love to share without being condescending about it. 

Usually can easily find room here to sit down and work on the WiFi inside, or hang out in the secluded back patio. 

Their cold brew iced coffee is not to be missed! Just the sight of the $2k cold brew drip tower is impressive - the product, even more so. Even though I'm normally a cream and sugar gal, I have to drink the cold brew unadorned to enjoy its mellow, fragrant complexity.
author: Cat C.

description: Its one of those study-able coffee shops with decent coffee. Its good for studying alone unless you plan to be outside. They have very small tables inside usually for one person and dim lighting. They have a bunch a outlets under the seats. Outside in the patio are a bunch of bar tables and sofas. Their coffee taste great. The only negative here is that their wifi seems to restrict me from going on certain websites that are very widely use. Overall, I would still comeback to work alone.
author: Yushi C.

description:
Most delicious cappuccino I've ever had!

They've essentially ruined all other cappuccinos for me! I'm seriously on the hunt for a cup that measures up to them here at home in Canada!
author: S S.

description:
The chai tea is really good, but it's $4. The hot tea is $4 too. A bit too pricey for me. I guess that's what coffee and tea costs at these kinds of coffee shops these days.
