Free wifi from next door. Plugs at many of the tables, under the seat. 
--  Network: porkstorecafe
--  Password: ilovebacon

The bathroom is a typical Mission coffee shop bathroom. I wish it were cleaner. I wish it was always fully stocked with toilet paper. I wish they offered toilet seat covers.
author: T N.

description: Super friendly, outdoor and inside seating. I'll be visiting this place often.
author: Tyler T.

description: Nice place, very trendy looking if you're into that. They made me a great breve latte!
author: Rustan M.

description: Home of one of the Slayer Machines. If you want something quick and mediocre go to Starbucks. If you want something brewed to perfection go to this place. A great cup of coffee will change your day.
author: Manny G.

description:
This past Saturday, after a bowl of Ramen from a joint up the street, me and my companion decided we really wanted a cup of coffee. It just felt like the thing to do. 

So we made our way down 16th street and happened upon Stanza Coffee. It was literally the first place we came across that had what we were looking for.

So we walked in and ordered two mochas. We stood in front of the barista as we watched him masterfully create the most gorgeous cup of coffee I ever seen. Leaf made of cream and all. 

The best part? While we were waiting, they played Dr. Dre's 2001 album. Unedited. 

Needless to say, I WILL be coming back here again. Bravo!

Extra points for atmosphere and décor :)
author: Dominique V.

description: I love Stanza! Their Turning Point coffee is amazing! Brad is super nice and always makes the perfect cup! Bonus points for the cold brew mechanism and awesome art around the cafe!
author: Supreet C.

description: The only place in America where you'll find Jesus serving you coffee. It's an enlightening experience to say the least.
author: Ashok R.

description:
Great find.  Pour over coffee and press coffee selections.  Pastries and snacks, including one of the best chocolate chip cookies I have had in a long time.

Prices were reasonable. $4 for pour over.  Excellent cup of coffee.

Nice chairs and internet. Single restroom provided.
author: Nathan T.

description: The inside is nice and great for doing work if you manage to get one of the tables. There aren't a whole lot. Some spaces have outlets, so seek those out. The high table does not have outlets. The wifi is reliable and free. The back patio is kind of dirty, not sure why there are big cushy pleather sofas because they get dirty easily and could use a wipedown. They serve coffee via individual pourover and french press. I liked their cold brew a lot. They use De La Paz beans. Good music and service. Pet friendly.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I puttered over to this little coffee shop with my three-person writing group one recent Sunday afternoon for some drinks and a space to write collaboratively. I really (as in, really, really) enjoyed my iced almond milk latte. My friend's salad looked pretty amazeballs too. 

The inside space itself is quite nice, although it was packed with people by the time we arrived (around 2 or 3 on a Sunday). The wait for drinks was about standard (unless you're used to Blue Bottle waits; then it was lightning fast in comparison). The ambiance inside is dark (even with the sun bright overhead in typical perfect Mission weather), but in a cozy, rather than slasher flick, way, and there were a variety of different seating options, including a little patio out front with a few tables and chairs.

The problem? No space for three people to comfortably commune and get our writing groove on -- at least not until my friend led me out back.

I'm not sure if the patio is shared by neighboring Pork Store Cafe or if it's entirely Stanza's domain. Either way, the back patio is entirely fenced off and shaded from glaring sunlight, and there were a lot of options for seating, with tables and big cushioned chairs. There were even a few extension cords where we could plug in our laptops, which was a plus. The people around us were quiet and polite.

My only real complaint was lack of bathroom maintenance. I was there for a total of three hours, but there was no toilet paper the entire time. Maybe that's on me for not reporting it, but if that was the case, no one else did either. You'd think at least one staffer would've noticed it during that time and addressed the issue.

Otherwise, good drinks, nice space. And, if you start craving a larger meal in the process, Pork Store Cafe's a good option, and it's right next door. Coincidence? I think not.
author: Andrew S.

description: One of the best iced teas I have ever had (Infusion iced tea). And the barrister was super nice too! :)
author: Saziya L.

description: Love this little spot in the Mission. I searched for a good study spot near my work, and sure enough I've found my go to cafe! I went around 3pm on a Wednesday, not crowded at all, which I really enjoy. Feel good music whether you choose to sit inside or outside. Ordered a really delicious $4 iced coffee, and did my homework in their back patio where they beautifully set up some old restaurant booths and tables. I love that this cafe is quiet, yet cool in atmosphere. They have plenty of plugs for your electronic needs. Small menu, but the quality makes up for it. Overall, this is just an awesome place to head to in the mission if you're looking to get some work done, or if you just feel like chillin' in the back with a nice cup of joe, away from the city noise and ruckus. Thumbs up!
author: Desiree S.

description:
Solid spot. Except the black leather chairs near the entrance are awkwardly shaped--do I put my elbows on the "arm rest" and ending looking like a scare crow with a back problem.

Great coffee, great free wifi. Come here to get some work done and be seen typing away on your macbook air.
author: Andy J.

description:
These guys are great. Their coffee is delicious, with some specialties such as long-pull espresso, pour-overs, French presses, and smooth espressos for the discerning coffee drinker. Their prices are in-line with area coffee shops but the quality is better in my opinion. $3.5 for a cappuccino as of this writing, $4 for a fancy pour-over. Additional bonus points for having a friendly and chill attitude, which isn't as common in some of the other artisanal cafés.

The decor, music, and lighting is great. The layout and furniture is conducive to meeting friends, working, or even having small meetings. They also have adequate electrical outlets, thank you!
author: Skyler S.

description:
Whoa.

Best coffee I've had in a very long time. Smooth, no sourness, perfect balance. I ordered a macchiato that the barista made with Intelligentsia beans (in case you are wondering).

Great ambience, mellow, clean without being sterile. Welcoming, friendly people behind the counter. They were playing Sting albums this morning: I totally approve.

I think this might be the coffee shop I've been searching for since I moved to San Francisco two years ago...
author: Neha B.

description:
Went there yesterday...here is what happened...
Me: can get one pumpkin spice muffin, a blueberry muffin, and a cappuccino
"hipster" barista(straight face): sure
Me: oh!, can you please make it wet
"hipster" barista(looking at me like he just swallowed his own tongue): that's a Starbucks thing, we don't do it here
Me(shocked, and in a guilty voice): ok, then give me a latté.
So, I just paid, $11 freaking dollars to experience your smugness. Next time I plan to go to a place where when I pay I get my coffee the way I want it...lastly "u hipsters are just lame, and I laugh at you" hahaha...
author: BOSHIKA T.

description:
Great place to hole up and get some work done! The minimal menu of coffee means a focus on quality. Pair that with good seating options, and enough foot traffic to keep the environment interesting (but not so much as to become distracted), and you have an awesome little coffee shop that I'd certainly frequent. Now if only it weren't so far away from me...

Nice outdoors seating area for those warm summer Mission days too!
author: Emmeline A.

description: Bathrooms are disgusting. Womens bathroom is out of order, and both are gross. I won't go into detail. This place reeks of hipster attitude and the staff serve it up along with mediocre lattes. Sorry Stanza, I had better hopes. Two lattes took ages to come out, and they're not even busy. Oh well.
author: Wendy W.

description:
Awesome atmosphere, good service, and good coffee. I had a soy latte to go. It was yummy. It's also a good place to work for a bit or catch up with friends. I shouldn't tell you this, but when four barrel has 30+ people in line, Stanza is an excellent alternative (or my first choice.) The espresso is milder, closer to blue bottle than four barrel. I prefer my espresso less potent and more smooth, so this place wins in my eyes! 

Stop by. It'll be yummy and cool.
author: Sneha P.

description: Cool shop. Stopped in for an espresso and a bathroom break.  Nice staff. The outside seating was nice especially with the heat lamp. Good stop if you need a cup of coffee. No reason for not giving it 5 stars but it felt like something was missing.
author: Dillon W.

description:
A nice cafe near bart. My home office is quieter but it's more fun to meet around fresh coffee so I meet clients here sometimes. 

Stanza gets the balance of food and ambiance just right and I look forward to going back. There are not alot of food options so be aware of that. Wifi is fine. 

They do not offer decaf espresso and the barista will give you lots of interesting reasons why but they do have decaf drip - unless they run out for the day. Lots of nice tea options too as a backup.
author: ari s.

description:
Super hip coffee space blocks away from 16th Street Bart Station. Opens really early for the coffee drinker that needs to get work done! Everyone seemed to have a laptop but for those that wants to relish their coffee, they have a nice sunny patio in the back AND the front. 

Their bathroom is not my favorite but it gets the job done. Their drinks on average is ~$4 but their WiFi is pretty fast! 

p.s. They have outlets everywhere
author: Betty S.

description: Damn good coffee. Pro tip: replace the front door! I say that because I love this place.
author: Christopher M.

description: A most solid place to kick back with a quality pour over.  The seating both indoors and in the outdoor patio out front is ample and both WiFi and numerous outlets are available.  Can't complain!
author: Eric F.

description:
I love Stanza!  These guys (and girls) really know their coffee, and are always friendly, even early in the morning when I am grumpy.  The coffee is delicious - is it Mission blasphemy to say that it's better than places like Four Barrel? Because it is.  I've been getting the iced coffee, which is strong but not overbearing or bitter.

I love sitting out back in the patio area when it's sunny (they have murals and couches and shit!) or working inside, where there is almost always a comfy seat available with a power outlet nearby.  It's fairly quiet, so I usually get a lot done here.  Also free wifi!

Yeah so basically Stanza is awesome.
author: Niqui W.

description:
THE spot to go to if you're a writer, are studying for something or simply want to read a book. The ambiance is laid back and hipster-trendy (essentially trendy without trying to be trendy). 

The seats are extremely comfortable with tables that support 2-4 people and single bar-style seating. The baristas are friendly and down to earth with a deep passion for coffee. 

I LOVE their lattes - they are frothy, creamy, not very bitter and do exactly the trick to extract your utmost concentration. I personally love heading here when I need to get down to business and get some work done. 

Happy coffee-drinking, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description: Mocha was good. Like most of the fancy coffee places in the city it's a bit pricey for the size, but it's tasty, and the place was clean and sleek. Enjoyed working there for a few hours. They do close at 3pm on some days, despite what Yelp's listed hours say.
author: P U.

description: Stanza has excellent espresso, intelegencia beans, fast wifi and enough plugs to keep you're laptop going. Doesn't have the status or pretense of many 3rd wave cafés in the  mission district, but for my money I'll take Stanza over Four Barrel any day.
author: brandon f.

description: Hands down best Mocha I've ever had, I know the latte or cappuccino would be amazing as is and let the coffee speak for itself but I can't say no to chocolate but the flavor was so good!! Any time I'm in the area I'll make sure to stop in.
author: Haili B.

description:
Dig this little joint.

First came to this spot via a Yelp event, where Joshua, the barista with the tattoo of latte art on one side of his forearm, and the espresso porta-filter on the other side, held a little class on how to properly brew pour-overs and french presses. He's super into his craft, and it showed in his knowledge, how eager he was to share it, and how patient he was with homebrew newbs. 

Also, he makes a kickass cappuccino, so kudos. 

Stanza is a bit different from some of the other coffee shops in the city in that it carries beans from several different roasting companies. Which is awesome, because it means you can get a different flavor, even when ordering the same type of drink. 

Love their interior, it's feel luxuriously roomy, and love their back patio even more. Great spot.
author: Allison S.

description: It started pouring and I needed shelter and something warm so I popped in here for a tea. When I asked what teas they carried the girl pointed at a sign and seemed bothered to speak, which was actually kind of funny. Anyway the tea was good, can't go wrong with a green tea but not for $4.
author: Margo D.

description:
2 coffees and one tiny pastry = $9...ouch!
Coffee shops are milking us big time these days...
author: bob b.

description: This place has great ambiance, friendly baristas who clearly know the good stuff about making great coffee (and they are also happy to explain everything from the beans they're using to the importance of the coffee grinder particle distribution), and great product.  I had a cappuccino made with espresso beans from Quills in Louisville, all expertly made and explained by Joshua.  Thumbs up to all of the above.
author: D B.

description:
Friends of Dan know that I'm a Four Barrel partisan. I go there literally every morning, to have a regular date with my sweetie and to enjoy some of the best coffee ever made. That won't chage anytime soon.

Having said that. Opening more or less across the street from my place is Stanza, a new coffee shop that puts almost everywhere else I've been in SF to shame. I can count on one hand and have fingers left over which coffee joints do better. (I won't name them. But I do think Stanza is better than Ritual. And Sightglass.)

The pour over is amazing, and I just had a cappucino that tasted like chocolate milk and sweet childhood memories. When I need wifi and can't afford the distraction of seeing everyone I know in the Mission, Stanza is where you'll find me.
author: Dan S.

description:
Incredibly delicious coffee.  This is the first coffee I've tried that had so much flavor on its own that I didn't want to put any cream or sugar in it.  Loaded with subtle tastes and flavors.

As other Yelpers have noted, they have a rotating cast of beans and roasters, so I guess it's best not to get too attached to any one flavor, and maintain an open mind (kind of like how Trader Joe's runs out of your favorite item every now and then, have you noticed that?)  That being said, their Ethiopian IDIDO is AMAZING!!!

I think, given the high quality of the coffee, this place is actually a bargain compared to other spots.  They charge a very reasonable price for a cup here.  

What to expect:  super-slow, super meticulous pours of artisan coffee.  This place makes Philz look like McDonald's in comparison.  They lovingly warm the glass, take their time with the pour over, etc.  Like Lou Reed once said, "First thing you learn is that you always gotta wait!"  But, so worth it.  Caffeinated ambrosia in a cup.

By the way, if you are EATING next door at Pork Store Cafe (incredible breakfasts) you can get Stanza coffee with your meal.  Your waiter/waitress can bring Stanza to your table.  

These guys are extreme coffee geeks, but not snobs.  They are happy to educate you and share their passion for beans, roasters, etc., so don't be shy or ashamed of your lack of knowledge.  I know very little, but I knows what I likes, and what I likes is some Stanza!  Cheers!
author: FoodDudeS F.

description:
The only reason why this place didn't get 4 stars is because I can't honestly say that I'm a fan. 

Was my coffee good...yes it was tasty and the barista seems to enjoy the drink making process. 

But hmm I could do without their "meh" attitude...I know I'm not there to make friends with the staff but a smile would have been nice.
author: Gabby A.

description:
This is a great spot for good coffee--without the super long lines and general crowdedness that you'll find at Four Barrel. I've never had a bad cup from here, and the baristas are always friendly in a way that doesn't overwhelm or hurry you on. My cups have always been to go, but I would definitely meet friends here or bring a book and sit a while if given the chance. I also like that almost every aspect of the space is minimal. There aren't too many decorations, the selection of coffee-related wares is small (but nice), and there's only one type of sweetener and cream out. Simplify!

The loss of one star is because I'm not a big fan of the type of doughnuts they carry, which is almost the only kind of pastry they have. But if you like cakey doughnuts dipped in icing-type things (and I know many a person that does!), then you'll love the selection.
author: Shelby W.

description: Not a great place for getting coffee and working. The tables in the back are too high for the bar stool and the tables in the front are either wobbly or have a weird barrel frame that pops up and doesn't make it easy for typing. This is painful right now to write this review. Coffee is expensive, go to flywheel for a better experience and cheaper coffee just down the street.
author: Eddie L.

description:
The newest good coffee place in the mission, Only a month old, they're still small enough to avoid a busy morning line but growing bigger by the day. 
It isn't a roaster but a rotating coffee bar, so they offer small lots from roasters around sf and around the country served french press, pour over, and espresso drink options depending on how the type of coffee best tastes. Also, they have artisan teas from red blossom. The single origin espressos are dialed in meticulously when they get in a new bean. They pull on the Slayer II espresso machine, and they're the only cafe in the city with it. It's another one-off place with just a few solid employees so you can become a regular fast. And they are mostly easy on the eyes, handshaking kind of boys. Every so often the music can get loud in the afternoon but there's outdoor seating as well and the music is usually pretty good stuff.

Yeah, they have cream behind the counter and not out, you should kind of get over it and try the coffee without it. Those types of places are proud of their choices in roasters and coffees, though you can always ask for it and they won't judge. Some places in the city can get a bit impersonal and holier than thou. They'll answer any questions and enjoy discussion. Free wifi, and awesome vegan doughnuts. It looks sort of like a dark french brasserie too, tucked away watching a busy 16th street. If you like or know something about coffee, you'll like this place (and vice versa).
author: Elizabeth ..

description:
LOVE this place. Living in the mission you get stuck going to your usual spots (Coffee Bar and Phiz) but I was with a friend and did not want to deal with the usual shit show that is Four Barrel and happened to walk by Stanza. 

First thought was "didnt this used to be that hookah place?" and yes, it did. It has a cute patio in front and the inside is dark and great to bring your computer in and get some work done. The service was SO FRIENDLY. I have forgotten what it is like to go into a coffee spot and not be judged. Felt so good. Then to my surprise they have a huge patio outback that has a ton of seating and sunny. 

Great little spot and I will definitely be back.
author: Colleen B.

description:
I was skeptical at first...but it really is a fantastic place for coffee.

The dudes who work here are solid. They're willing to talk coffee and explain why they do things a certain way. 

The do: espresso and a doughnut.
author: Z. H.

description:
One of my favorite cafes in the Mission thus far. Was here late-morning on a Saturday. Plenty of space, airy yet intimate, eclectic and comfortable. Good lighting for doing computer work. 

Coffee was lovely. Caramelly, smooth, buoyant, medium body, not too bright, just an all-around great cup to start the day. Kinda pricey at $4.50, but it had just won a prestigious competition and was limited in quantity. Worth it.

Music was kind of loud, but at least it wasn't bad or obnoxious. The only negative was...please don't bicker about music, baristas. It's unpleasant to listen to and like sooo hipster. Come on. :)

Lots of outlets and space to work. Free wi-fi! I think I sat there for three hours. It wasn't busy.

There is a sunny patio in the back, or a partially enclosed front patio, if you feel so inclined. Lots of micro-spaces, lots of options.
author: Heidi H.

description:
I know that my reviews generally tend to be GLOWING.  Especially when I go to a place for the first time and the staff is generally nice to me, have good service or the product is pleasing to me in appearance or taste.  I also know that I have lots of people who disagree with me about price point and taste.  

Yet, honestly, I like the pour over that I ordered here.  I like my coffee subtle with lingering flavors and finishes on my tongue.  I like that the coffee here is NOT scalding hot or overly roasted so that all that you taste is CHARCOAL.  I like that there is not a long line of people angrily tapping their feet or trying to rush your order.  I like it when people behind the bar answer your questions and provide you with information to make you a little more knowledgeable.

Okay, so the demeanor of the individual baristas can be a little intimidating for an average person.  Yet, oh well, you only live life once.  

So, customer service would be 3 stars (a-ok) and the coffee for me 4.  The dimly lit booths 3, the outdoor patio in the back and front would be a 4.5.  I like the music, but there is only 1 unisex bathroom for a large space.  The price point can be steep for a girl on a budget, yet, I find that these days the coffee shops of this caliber, which are armed with knowledgeable baristas and serving specialty coffee are charging around the same price point.   

It does seem like mixed feelings, but I'll definitely be back for the pour-over coffee and the really relaxed vibe.  Some people complain about snobbery or such, but I think it actually is relaxing and not too overly stimulating for the senses.

 I say that this is my SPLURGE or DATE coffee.  It isn't a starbuck's or peet's and I don't think that Stanza or its comrades are trying to be.  I think that they are aiming for a lifestyle and educational experience while challenging each other to raise the bar (ista).  I think that they are also catering to the dynamically changing neighborhood clientele.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
Stumbled into Stanza on our way from Pork Store, next door, and had had some of their sludgy but nonetheless flavorless coffee. We were on the prowl for something better, but didn't want to walk to Four Barrel. This place hit the spot nicely -- real care for the art of coffee-making without too much pretense. (There's just enough pretense in the joint, but the staff weren't the source of it. They were really nice.)

- Nice written menu of coffees to choose from
- Did a quick and good job on a pour-over drip
- Coffee was very good
- Took Square Wallet, so I paid with my smile
- Hot employees (yay!)
- Decor

Wasn't sure about those donuts, but I didn't try one, so I won't knock 'em. Someone walked in and said, "those donuts look amazing!" But they didn't. She was just hungry. They looked like donuts on pieces of wood.

On a scale of "silly" to "nasty," where Craftsman and Wolves is silly and Dunkin' Donuts is nasty, this place is "terrific." Nice to have something closer to my place.

ONE MORE HAUGHTY COFFEE PLACE IN THE MISSION FTW!!!1! Gentrification complete.
author: Matt M.

description:
BACK PATIO - don't be shy! Seriously superb pour - over black coffee. Watch the Kyoto drip if you're spacing out over your work :) The ambiance in here, by the way, is conducive to getting it done  - outside of rush hour of course. Stanza hosts cuppings occasionally - don't miss it! 

The baristas are geekin on caffeine - which, in this case, is a good thing. They're modest about it, but two of them are celebs.  The featured roasts are on rotation and their Ethiopians are always a home run. The pastries are BIG - hubba hubba :)
author: Jama L.

description:
I'm really into this place -- the atmosphere is quiet, casual, and intimate, which is everything I need a coffee shop to be. The baristas are friendly and personable, and the coffee is some of the best I've had in the city. The menu is extremely simple, which is a plus for someone as indecisive as I am, but certainly a drawback for those who fancy a varied selection of flavored lattes. Also worth noting is that most of the booths and tables offer power outlets, making this place very laptop-friendly.

My only real qualm about Stanza is the pricing, which is enough of a con to bump it down to four stars for me as I'm extremely frugal. It's also not the greatest location for people watching as it's sort of set back from the street, but sometimes you do need to get away from the hustle and bustle of Mission denizens for a bit.

If you're looking for an intimate place to have coffee with a friend or two in the Mission, Stanza is at the top of my list.
author: Seth G.

description: We got the pour over iced coffee. Great taste! The art was cool and so was the atmosphere. I reccomend this place if you're looking for a quick pick me up
author: Ava S.

description:
This new coffee shoppe is a wonderful addition to the mission coffee scene! 

Stanza has quality coffee and for sure knows how to make it. Every cappuccino and drink I've gotten there has been outstanding. (and I don't say that lightly...)

The workers are all hilarious and love what they do. They're all down to earth guys making exceptional coffee. 

I definitely recommend going to stanza! It's a great place to grab a cup of coffee on the run or sit and enjoy it with friends or a good book. It's also a great place to camp out during finals week... free wifi, outlets & wonderful coffee. What could be better? ;)
author: Hannah M.

description: Decent and relaxed coffee place in the Mission. Check out the back patio.
author: Jonas H.

description: An OK cup from the hands of a stilted employee in an environment that's trying a little too hard to be cool and rough around the edges. Good if you want to feel ever so slightly uncomfortable (but in an unthreatening way), or some externalities make no other place as convenient.
author: Jae R.

description:
Stanza has a great, though poorly furnished and rarely used, outdoor space.  It gets some really nice Mission sun.

Otherwise, this spot is pretty meh.  The baristas are among the slowest I've ever experienced and $4 for an iced coffee feels like highway robbery, even in SF.
author: Tim A.

description: I accidentally left something in the bathroom, and an employee held it for me until the next day. :) Also, the pastries are pretty yummy.
author: Jessica S.

description: Pretty good coffee for the price and the baked goods are delicious.  When I went the back patio was closed, such a bummer.  Honestly, the homeless outside is my biggest complaint as they are usually panhandling as you walk in, but that can't be helped. There are also flies that get into the shop, as they leave the doors open sometimes... But the coffee and atmosphere are pretty good. Nothing to write home about, but a good place to study and just chill.
author: Laura D.

description:
Pour over Coffee too acidic. Spicy front no aftertaste. Also not hot enough. Not worth $4. 

Also the strawberry jam looks like its seen better days. I think it's supposed to be red.
author: Marcus E.

description:
In a nutshell-- good coffee, wonderful environment, definitely a hidden gem in the Mission.

Had a Guatemalan Blend pourover: described as fruity, honey. Perfect temperature, smooth, rich and flavorful, as described. Not as good upon cooling (which I value, taste should change but still taste good) 

Ambiance is wonderful-- light music, outlets, not crowded.

Service is delightful-- wifi network name so witty and made my morning +1 star
author: Fion L.

description: Good coffee but no discounted refills? That's bad business. So-so customer service as well.
author: Nate S.

description:
Fabulous spot for studying / work: really cool / laidback ambiance with comfy seating, ample outlets, and, most importantly, awesome R&B playing in the background. 

Friendly / not-uppity baristas (I'm thinking Ritual-esque when I say uppity) -- my extreme lack of coffee knowledge was surfaced within seconds of ordering, and he totally helped me play it off. 

Can't wait to go back
author: Meghana D.

description:
Wow, coffee from exotic locals like Kansas or North Carolina. Huh? Locovore, not! Went for the Ethiopian drip. Hard to go wrong with Ethiopian. Or so, I thought. "Here, smell this" the barista said, offering the grounds before the pour. I smelled. Smelled - um - green.  As in: the roast didn't make it to the first crack kinda green. 

The only pastries on offer were donuts. Tried a bit of the chocolate. Meh. If you like Pebbles, then fine. Maybe you'd like the rest of mine? (Oh, imaginary yelp companion?)

Maybe no WiFi.  They all had passwords. Didn't ask. The music started pretty chill (which is why I stopped in). And then it wasn't. Table wobbled. Was the only customer. And then I left. Rather Zen like emptiness.

one sip and a bite
a still life of unfinished
upon my leaving
author: iko o.

description: These guys know what they're doing. Perfect cappuccino thats warms the soul. They take their time and put love into every cup they serve.
author: tricia m.

description: This is a nice little coffee shop in the area and a great place to study. I enjoyed the music and the atmosphere and it was not too crowded. The two baristas were friendly and very easy-going. I had the drip latte and it was tasty (it is nice to have quality for my caffeine needs every once in a while). My friend got the soy latte and the milk was a bit over-heated but they were nice enough to re-make it. I will definitely go back when I want a good coffee and good study spot.
author: Marcus T.

description: Super friendly baristas. Great coffee, free wifi, outdoor front covered patio, bike friendly.  Need I say more..
author: Jenn L.

description: They make a great soy latte. Baristas are friendly, the place to order vs. pay is a little disorganized. Quiet, cozy and not overcrowded!!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Stumbled upon this after lunch at Pakwan. Old hookah bar turned hipster coffee shop.

Star for being open on New Year's Day.  The guys working there were super nice and unlike Four Barrel, that has nasty ass almond milk, this place has soy. Woot woot.  Got a soy cappucino that was pretty delish. This place is no sight glass, but it'll hit the spot at 16th and valencia.
author: Skye W.

description: Great ambiance and friendly baristas. The space and design feels intimate even though it has tall ceilings. I loved the front door, grey walls and cool art.  The chai latte was delicious. I will come back and sit outside on a warmer day.
author: Susan K.

description: Great coffee. Very comparable to Ritual, Sight Glass and Four Barrel. The ambiance is more cozy for sure with the booths.
author: Asif I.

description: This place is pretentious hipster coffee shop as many  around. However, the quality of my dripped coffee was disappointing. The coffee came out so bitter that I could not finish it. They also run out of cream and said, well you have to drink as it is. Not coming back.
author: Nadia A.

description: Best coffee & Latte Ever !!  Service is Great and Management is Amazing.. Don't miss this place, its a must while in San Francisco !
author: Gigi H.

description:
I don't like it.  Stand-offish, unfriendly, snobby vibe, not just from the staff but from the decor as well.  Half n half in an unmarked golden genie bottle?  This seems like the kind of place that values snob appeal above actual honest-to-good quality and service, and that's a huge turnoff for me.  I tried their cold brew and their french press, both were unpleasantly sour, and even more sour once sweetened.  All the (non-espresso) coffee looked very overpriced.  And like I said, the taste was definitely sub-par.  Just about any place in the city I have tried is better than this.  If you want fantastic $4 pour-over coffee find that Blue Bottle stuff!

The lattes look real pretty though, and the prices on those are standard.
author: Sofia O.

description: Stanza has great teas, heavenly pastries by Mr. Holmes SF and outstanding customer service. The cardamom scone is perfection...and if ya' get there near closing you might even get a special treat. Great neighborhood spot with down-home folks!
author: Lila R.

description: I'm not normally a coffee drinker but I was here at the behest of a friend who was raving about their coffee so I decided to order my old favorite - a flat white. Now, Americans aren't really familiar with them but my barista knew what it was - though for some reason served it in an espresso glass instead of a coffee cup. But hey, it tasted pretty darn good, considering. I got a blueberry muffin which was fantastic!
author: David M.

description: I wanted to get away from my town. SF was the place for me. I searched for a great coffee spot in SF and yelp delivered. The customer service was great. Everyone was friendly. They had great recommendations. There hot chocolate was really good. I also had..... I think an espresso.... Either way it was good. When I come back to SF I will definitely be stopping in again.
author: Thatguy E.

description: I love the design, layout and general ambience of this adorable coffee shop. It is very clean and a marked difference from the street outside. The staff are friendly and efficient. The pastries are amazing and I highly recommend the chocolate chip sea salt cookie! Coffee is good and prices on par with everyone else. Defiantly a spot to go for a coffee if you find yourself in this area.
author: Sandra B.

description: The space was great.  Various tables, free wi-fi, outlets, great outdoor area.  Coffee was good, pretty pricey but standard.  The staff on the other hand was not friendly or welcoming.. in fact, the customers were more helpful than the staff.
author: Lanes S.

description: amazing coffee and amazing pastries from mission beach cafe. the only reason for 4 stars and not 5 is that the baristas are literally the slowest ive ever encountered in my entire life. a baby sloth could cross the street before my espresso would be ready.
author: Some B.

description: I feel kind of bad for cheating on my more local-er (ie, less than 2 blocks away) coffee shop, but I've been to Stanza twice now for a soy mocha and Oh. My. God. Just beautiful. I'm not sure I've ever had a more perfectly foamed espresso drink. Like sipping velvet. My more local-er place is lucky that I have to walk half a mile to Stanza; otherwise I'd probably be going here more often. Love the cute back patio area too!
author: Angela B.

description: Had the coffee of the day (light blend,can't recall name)...by far one of the  most disappt'g, worst coffees I've had, esp from a hip, trendy coffee hou$e, price, etc. Office coffee is better...and it really should've no more than $1.
author: Patty L.

description: This place is ok. Seats are comfy, there is free wifi and it's a nice space. But it is NOT quiet, as I was led to believe by the Yelp description and other people's reviews. Also, I don't care what it's made out of - $4 for a cup of coffee is excessive.
author: Charlotte M.

description:
i realize that when anyone in san francisco announces the arrival of yet another coffee shop, a sudden onset eye-roll is almost certainly guaranteed, but i daresay this superfluous coffee shop is definitely setting itself apart from the rest.  

aside from the coffee being delicious (it definitely is), i really dig the fact that stanza isn't committed to one roaster.  instead, you get a well-described menu (read: options!  opportunities to taste from new roasters!) to choose from, and a pair of extremely lovable, judgment-free lads that offer solid (and sometimes humorous) advice.   

also, the place looks amazing.  i passed by stanza without any intention (or need) for more caffeine, but couldn't resist the beautiful, tucked-away storefront.  needless to say, i'll definitely be lured back soon.
author: Mooni P.

description: Delicious pourover coffees and great seating. Awesome for getting some work done. If you want something a little stronger and cheaper than a pourover, try a french press coffee.
author: Jay T.

description:
I was here yesterday and had an iced latte (simple, straight to the point and damn good, also not much more than a latte anywhere else for much better coffee). I also love the ambiance of this place because it's in The Mission, they serve really good coffee and they're actually nice and no one I saw seemed even the least bit pretentious. Also this is a great place to do work. I was working for at least 4 hours in a really comfy and clean booth type chair next to an outlet at a clean table at the perfect height. It was quiet and got some sun, and it even had a nice back patio that I would have gone out to enjoy if I wasn't stuck at my shitty laptop that can't hold a charge for too long. Stanza keeps it simple. Good, like really good, coffee, nice friendly staff and a great seating setup with free wifi. I'm just bummed it isn't closer to home, otherwise this would be my regular coffee spot to work in.

I've been to the one in the Haight, and for some reason, I wouldn't give it the full five stars, maybe it just seemed a little out of place, and too fancy to be a good work spot,  but I'd be willing to try it again 'cause it's closer to home.
author: Charlene D.

description: Pretty good coffee weird music, wifi which is nice cause all those fancy hipster places Don't have it!! But the seating is really uncomfortable and it's usually pretty dark in there, kinda of a depressing vibe.
author: Clark L.

description: Just tried stanza today...great little place, been open a year. Tried a latte which was  really well made...good ambiance. I'll def stop by again.
author: Roy N.

description: Came to this place not knowing what to expect and I left loving it. Low key, great little area to sit and eat, and unassuming. Highly recommend.
author: Danny S.

description: Is this coffee even legal? The only way a beverage should be this good if it's made out of unicorns, or crack.
author: Janna M.

description: Nice place. Good coffee, a delicious pop tart (yes pop tart but not the Kellogg's variety), welcoming staff and a good sit down and read your book for a while venue.
author: Dominic M.

description: Delicious delicious coffee, great decor, and super comfortable to just sit and sip! I had this idido washed coffee that I can't stop thinking about there. Nice guys too! My new favorite spot in the mission, not a machine experience like at ritual or a hipster conclave like four barrel.
author: matt b.

description: 3.50 for a small, barely caffeinated, light brown ice coffee.  What is this, Tokyo 2025?  They can cater to the Facebook types that are fucking up the neighborhood, but I will definitely not go there again.  I asked why if they were sure, and they gave me a bunch of slack.  Life is too short.
author: Jack M.

description:
Best Cafe on the Mission thus far!

I have been to various Cafés in the Mission and could never find one that had the perfect combination to my taste, which is: GREAT coffee, not super noisy, friendly customer service, comfortable seating, clean, well-decorated, well-located, and good lighting.

They change their selection of coffee on the hourly basis and the quality of their coffee is high. The music level is to the point that you can put your headphones on and not hear a mix between your music and the Café's. The Baristas that usually work the shift that I am in are Josh and Devin, they are super cool guys that are easy going and get their job done. The owner is also in a lot and is always in a great mood and ready to hear any of your input; I had a critic to make and he listened with open ears and gave me his full attention. They also asked me for my name the second day I came in and haven't forgotten it since. The seating here is awesome, for they are couch/benches, meaning you have about a meter in a half of space for yourself. The location is also something awesome that adds even further to this place, it's on 16th and mission, just off the 16th Bart station, and the cooler part of Valencia. Lighting is just right, not too bright nor too dark, creating a great place for my reading. 

To add even further, they have a front and back patio decorated with great taste, for the sunny days.

I feel really bad in writing this review in the sense that it will attract more business not leaving a seat for me, but I got to give it to these guys and figured since it will naturally become a hit, give them their well deserved merit. They have done a great job in creating a great place to have a cup of coffee and be productive with a cool environment. 

In summary, If you are looking for a place to get work done while enjoying a high quality of coffee being in a great ambiance, this is the place.
author: Joao P.

description: The lighting is indeed cozy, but that was about it for me--pretentious expensive $4 cup of tea (and I'll pay good money for a good pot of tea), awkward bar stools and a too-tall counter, rave music that made me want to pull my hair out, and otherwise the place was completely silent--no one talking, everyone staring at a computer or book. Not for me.
author: LA M.

description: Super hipster coffee shop, but their coffee and donuts can't be beat! Great place for a meeting/chat too - not loud and overflowing with people like Four Barrel (a setting which has its place, but not so much for comfortable meetings).
author: Emily M.

description: Had a mocha, they had no non fat milk. It was good coffee. Looked at the pastries, saw a bunch of little flies on them.. Gross!! The outside patio needs a lot of cleaning. Would not go again.
author: Brenda S.

description: i think i just found a new worthwhile caffeine oasis in the mission:  plenty of seating, assorted pastries and even has free wifi.  But actually its all about the coffee.  Darn good cappuccino, and amazing pour over by the mug.  I tried the Ethiopian Sutamo and its was rich and complex.  Menu board described its with "Cherry notes" and "the bomb."  Indeed, it was a cherrybomb!  (also my favorite song by the spoons).   So if four barrel is getting too hipster and ritual is just too crowded, then maybe Stanza is your next stop.
author: Joseph C.

description: The Slayer offered a mean espresso this morning!  The french press of my Stanze blend was delicious as well.  A delightful pre-holiday danish and muffin treat with outstanding service from the baristas!
author: lisa g.

description: For legit hardcore coffee drinkers. This shizz was intense.
author: Rebekah S.

description: Love getting my chai here. Also, a great place to do some work since there is free wifi and it's not very crowded.
author: Monica W.

description: The vibe of Stanza is cool and the baristas are friendly and knowledgeable. The coffee is delicious and made to order. The only down side is that they only have one size cup, 10 oz! C'mon guys, a 16 oz cup of joe is the standard for someone wanting a medium to large cup. At least give us the choice.
author: Matt H.

description:
Just stopped by Stanza this morning on my way to my studio.  I really enjoy Four Barrel but most mornings the line is just too long.  I've been looking for an alternative and have tried a few places, but I think I have now found my spot.

Excellent espresso, friendly baristas, and no long line (yet?).  I'll be swinging by often and enjoying the fine woodwork around the front door :)
author: Steve R.

description: Great find in The Mission. Non-pretentious vibe, super friendly and helpful baristas, free wi-fi and really relaxed ambiance. Awesome place to get some work done or have a cup of jo with friends. Definitely will go back!
author: Keidi R.

description: My french press coffee was great & my husband's mocha was delicious.  The seating options & free Wi-Fi are great.  It has the very hipster- uber-cool- snobby vibe though & one of the types of coffee is $7 per cup which is ridiculous.
author: Christy L.

description: Surprisingly pricey.  5 bucks for coffee, not that great.  Dark, cave like atmosphere.  Staff was quite friendly
author: Anon A.

description: I dont think I've had a great tasting mocha before coming here! Their mocha is delicious! It has just the right sweetness and wasn't milked down. Love the frothiness of the foam and how it mixed with the espresso. Yumminess all over. The ambiance of the cafe has a tense loungey maybe-im-a-wine-bar feel..like I probably wouldn't have come in if I didnt know for sure this was a coffee shop that actually sold coffee for $5. But the outside is nice.  So i stayed there.
author: Mila B.

description: Very good coffee but so very slow. We were the only people in the store and it still took forever to get our coffees. I know it's cold but show some motivation, guys!
author: Eva R.

description: Similar to the Stanza in Haight, this location provide a comfortable interior for you to sip your coffee slowly.  The barristas are very friendly, eager to help, without an onze of attitude. However, the coffee itself just wasn't that great. A little too acidic for my taste. Or maybe I am just too much of a Blue Bottle devotee to know how to enjoy a different flavor.
author: Candice B.

description: Best soy latte in San Francisco.  This cafe is a hidden gem of the Mission. The staff is super friendly and unpretentious, the drinks are awesome, it isn't too crowded, and there is WiFI.  Couldn't be happier.  Feel free to come in and get a drink, but don't stay and hang out because I want to continue to be able to get a table whenever I want :-)
author: Tom P.

description: Came back again and they replaced the Nirvana with Biggie and Juvenile.  Nothing like seeing a bunch of tech-sters bob their heads in unison while working on identical Apple computers.  New favorite place.  Maybe ever.
author: James S.

description: I'm re-doing my review. I am now much more of a fan , and love the art . Not as much of a zoo as Four Barrel
author: Lauren V.

description: They have a sign "we don't serve a normal cup of coffee".  I ordered a quad-americano and got warm water in a dixie cup.  Save your money and go to 7-11 instead.  Loved the 80's rap music blasting though!  I should have listened to their signage!
author: El C.

description: Stanza is a great, laid-back spot if you want some good coffee and a quiet place to read or work. Too bad they don't serve wine anymore!
author: Winnie L.

description: Good coffee brewed on site - very cool people there too!!
author: Richard D.

description: Great coffee, friendly service, comfy atmosphere- pretty much everything you could ask for in a neighborhood coffee spot! The decor is interesting and when I asked the barista about it he told me the previous place was a hookah spot but it blends nicely and gives you something to take in while you enjoy your coffee and good vibes
author: Twila G.

description: The spear tip of gentrification stabbing just north of Valencia, this coffee shop delivers EXACTLY as expected.  Uber hip.  Cool, friendly baristas.  Good music pumped over premium speakers expertly placed by an aspiring DJ with acoustics knowledge (assuming).  Only giving it 4 stars because the tea was $4, I didn't feel I could afford tipping on top of that, and that EXACTY expresses the bad things happening to SF with all this tech money coming in.  Now, back to my macbook Pro to do tech work :p
author: Six B.

description: These guys know their coffee.  It is our new favorite local coffee shop.  The coffee is good and the owners/workers are incredibly nice.  All that said, if you are in a rush this is not the place for you because they take the time to make every cup perfect so it takes a little while.  I wish they were open just a little earlier so I could go before I catch the BART to work.
author: Andrea G.

description: Good things are happening here.  The brews are solid and the selection of beans is great.  Good place to get some work done.
author: Rob W.

description: Worn-down leather seats, watered down soap in the bathroom, fly infestation in the entryway, and a location which attracts (and actually smells like) urine near the front door. Go to Four Barrel, you'll be much happier.
author: John D.

description:
this is my favorite place for coffee in the mission!  

these guys are serious about their coffee and they are super friendly and welcoming

i actually feel like a fellow human being there, not just a city zombie

its a beautiful space with nice lights, and a great place for chatting, reading, working, making art, etc

*bonus: yummy sweet treats, special teas, cool black toilets, current hidden gem
author: Angela M.

description: The coffee is pretty good but plan on bringing some noise cancelling headphones if you dont want to compliment your coffee experience with explicit rap music. It seems at least a particular barista doesn't care about what sort of music comes out of the speakers. My ideal coffee shop experience probably doesn't involve feeling the bass from the music either.
author: Michael P.

description: Tastiest espresso.  Free wifi.  Outlets.  Clean.  Friendly.  I'll fight to the death for this place.
author: Andrew M.

description: Decent drinks, nice music, easy to get a seat, and there are usually plugs available. The reason for my low rating is the bathroom --- it's disgusting.  It looks like it hasn't been cleaned in months.  Grody.
author: L V.

description: Stopped into this place this morning while walking to Four Barrel. Nice music and nice atmosphere but got a really strange vibe from the guys behind the counter. I asked what kind of milk they use and was told they have whole or half milk. I asked what brand and was told it's Clover. I asked if it's Organic, and they said it's not, and seemed irritated with my question. Then, I suggested they consider organic, and the guy behind the counter looked like he wanted to kill me, so I walked out. I don't care how good the coffee is, how well trained the baristas might be, or how nice the decor is. In my book, coffee isn't more than 2-stars when it's using milk laced with Monsanto rBGH, other hormones, antibiotics, and chemicals, and coming from cows that lived their lives under unimaginable cruelty. Granted, Clover is one of the better brands, but if a place aspires to be 4 or 5 star, then they should spend a few extra pennies to get organic milk from cows that were not abused in horrific ways. All of the top coffee shops use Clover Organic milk (Blue Bottle, Sightglass, Four Barrel, and Ritual), so it can be done. It's not that hard.
author: Eater S.

description: This is definitely the best coffee in the mission. Lots of care and great service. Totally recommend!
author: Christian A.

description: My husband had the cold brew and I had green tea. They were both great. It was my first time trying the cold brew but it was very tasty! The baked goods looked so good, but did not try. I will be back to try them out.
author: Akiko I.

description: nice filter pour.  i'd go back
author: Greg T.

description: Friendly, efficient staff, good soy lattes, Pepples' vegan donuts, strong wifi, soft seating, easy access to BART, long spacious interior, at times a little dark for us old school newspaper readers, but not bad.
author: Bob G.

description: Very mediocre. Odd that they serve coffee from Intelligentsia in LA when there are so many high quality local wholesale coffee companies they could support. Often out of decaf, perhaps they wouldn't have such a difficult time keeping things in stock if they bought locally. The outdoor seating in the back is their saving grace.
author: Marissa G.

description: Nice place. Just around the corner our home. Some time there are too many annoying hipsters but most of the time it is pleasant. They have a very good coffee and pastries.
author: Luca R.

description: Great coffee, free wifi and great location! Don't forget to checkout the patio in the back on a sunny day!
author: Francois C.

description: the guy behind the register said that the peanut butter and chocolate cookie was scrumptious and he was right.
author: Regina C.

description: Outstanding coffee program, so much heart put into this place. Love the staff too.
author: Christina V.

description: Went into this place on opening day and was beyond disappointed. I feel as though the owner flagged down the first hipster kid passing along while riding his fixed gear bike and hired him with virtually no experience. Watching them attempt a few cups of slow drip was amusing, to say the least. Not once, not twice but three times I witnessed coffee being dripped off the side of the beaker and into the drain. I corrected him the first time but couldn't help but laugh the next 2 times. Finally got my 4 dollar cup of coffee and it tasted like burnt charcoal. Here's the real kicker, NO CREAM is offered. What kind of elitest establishment is this that offers no cream and sugar that's served from a to-go coffee cup. "Ohhhh you're one of THOSE people who DRINKS coffee and doesn't ENJOY the coffee." Go eff yourself. If I want to sugar coat your disgusting coffee with cream and sugar, then so be it.
author: Jessica U.
